access: Entire apartment; Elevator Lobby, garage and parking lot.
description:
Embrace the rustic style and contemporary comfort of this updated apartment. The residence features repointed original brick walls, exposed ducts, colorful furnishings, an open-concept layout, and private parking.

- Entire Apartment Studio Loft (no enclosed/fully private bedroom) 
- 16’ ceiling. Carpet Flooring.  
- Elevator building.
- Queen size bed in a semi-private loft area (not enclosed room). Sleep 2.
- West Elm Sleeper Sofa (queen mattress). Sleep 2.
- Living Room sectional sofa for additional sleeping arrangement.
- Stokke® Sleepi™  Crib  (subject to availability)
- Walk-in Closet.  
- Washer + Dryer.  
- Full Kitchen. 
- Living Room features Amazon Fire TV, Record Player/Bluetooth Speaker
- Free Netflix!
- Fender Guitar + Amp.
- +200 books.
- Central Air.
- Free secured parkings.

Entire apartment; Elevator Lobby, garage and parking lot.

Always available in person or over the phone/ text.

The property is situated in the Chicago South Loop neighborhood. Walk to the lake front and marina, Northerly Island, Grant Park and the Loop, McCormick Place, and Chinatown. It is also a 10 minute walk to the “L” Train Stations or the Metra.

We are less than a 10-minute walk/ 3 minutes cab ride from the “L” Train Roosevelt Station.

By car, we are 5 minutes from the I-90/94's exit "Roosevelt Rd” or “18th St" (Eastbound only). 

Uber/ Lyft, and Divvy Bike are some of the best ways to get around town. The bike station is right around the corner. https://www.divvybikes.com

Spring-fall you can also catch the water taxi near Chinatown which takes you on a scenic route via the Chicago River to the heart of Chicago’s river walk.

Like most apartments in Chicago’s loop the “L” train tracks run nearby.  Trains run from the early morning until past midnight and can create some noise. We like to think of it as local charm.
house_rules:
1) Check-in is 3pm, and check-out is by noon. Please send us a message via the Airbnb App, or text us once you have checked out.

2) To ensure full safety of our guest’s and our belongings, please keep the entry door closed, and the August Smart Lock locked at all times.

3) Activities such as illegal drugs, prostitution, assigning or subletting are strictly forbidden.

4) No unapproved guests are allowed in the apartment. We may require valid government ID to be presented to obtain access to the unit. Guests under the age of 18 should be accompanied by a parent/guardian at all time while in the apartment.

5) Group gatherings, events, and parties are strictly prohibited without written approval.

6) We have a no smoking policy, although you are welcome to smoke in the downstairs parking lot.

7) We ask you to keep things on the quieter side after 10pm. 

8) Before checking out, please remove beddings and duvet cover and place used towels in the laundry basket.

9) If the trash bag is full during your stay, please place it into the waste dumpster in the parking lot.

access: In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms, and washer/dryer.
description:
This is a private room in a shared 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb). Restaurants, shops, bars, and public transit are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 10-minute train ride away via the nearby Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station.

Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.

Thanks so much for your interest in staying with us! We ask that you read through our entire listing to make sure that we're the right hosts for you. This is a private room in a shared 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb). 

THIS TROVE HAS

✔ Queen-size bed
✔ Turkish cotton bath and hand towels
✔ 55" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)
✔ Keurig coffee maker
✔ Body wash and shampoo
✔ Iron and ironing board
✔ Hair dryer
✔ Keyless Entry

--and more!

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower.  Included with your membership:

✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars
✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan
✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck

Metropolitan Club Hours:

Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm
Saturday: 5pm – 10pm
Sunday: Closed

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check out the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to our most frequently asked questions.

In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms, and washer/dryer.

We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is a 10-minute walk away.
→ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're around the corner from the Wrightwood 659 art gallery. Search for “Wrightwood 659 Gallery Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room.

Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.

3. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?”

We allow a maximum of two guests per room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info.

4. Will I have my own private bathroom?

The apartment has two shared bathrooms.

access: Private Bedroom that is only for guests on the second floor. Guest-only bathroom adjacent. Complete first floor access to living room and kitchen, back deck and yard. There's also a grand piano you are welcome to play.
description:
Private bedroom with Full Size bed in single family house.  Cable TV and private bathroom. Use of kitchen and first floor common areas. Charming and peaceful street. Four minute walk to CTA Red Line.  One of two available bedrooms.  To book both, reserve under my "Combined Bedrooms" listing and save $22 per night vs. booking separately.

In addition to the host, guests are free to socialize with my six pet ducks!  After a full day, watching these feathered friends paddle in the backyard pond is quite relaxing.  They'll happily take some corn or mealworms from your hand.  So come on "down". (Ha ha).

Private Bedroom that is only for guests on the second floor. Guest-only bathroom adjacent. Complete first floor access to living room and kitchen, back deck and yard. There's also a grand piano you are welcome to play.

I reside in the space as well and have my own master bedroom. I am away at work during the day, though you can call or text me.

4 Minute Walk to CTA Redline which will take you to the Magnificent Mile or the Loop in 35 minutes. The #36 Broadway Bus is a 2 minute walk. That will take you to the Uptown entertainment district (Aragon Ballroom, Riviera Theater, the Green Mill) in 10 minutes.

additional_house_rules:
REQUESTS: 
1) Please treat the home with respect.  There is a $250 fee for smoking, and the reservation will be terminated at your expense.
2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time indoors from 9pm-8am. 
3) The only guests allowed in the building are those on the reservation.  
4) Personal bathroom items must be kept in your room. If you use common spaces, we request you tidy up after yourself to keep the spaces clean for everyone (for example, kitchen items in dishwasher, wipe counters, throw out trash, etc).  

CHECK IN/OUT: Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time is by 10am. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply.  

For check out, I ask that you:  
- turn off lights in your room/common spaces  
- ensure your used kitchen items are in dishwasher 
- dispose of any of your food/drink from fridge and any of your trash from room/common spaces. If it's more than what fits in the trash can, please take it out and dispose in black bins behind building.  
- leave linens and towels in room

access:
You'll have a PRIVATE bedroom and bathroom on the 1st floor (not connected), then SHARE the kitchen and living room (on 1st floor) as well as laundry room (in basement) with guests in the 2 other bedrooms. All linens and towels are included.

KEYS There is self-entry anytime from 4pm on. You will be given 1 set of keys for your stay. If keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee.

CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC with a thermostat within the unit. The temperature is kept between 65-70 degrees for the comfort of all guests.

WASHER/DRYER A free washer and dryer are located within the unit. Detergent is also available for your use.
description:
Check out the full unit's reviews!! https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/19549132

Welcome to Chicago! Enjoy a wonderful stay in this PRIVATE ROOM with queen bed and PRIVATE bathroom. The unit overall is a 3-BR/2-bath duplex unit, located on a serene, residential side street. It has everything you need to make your visit seamless and comfortable. Plus, it's in a prime location with easy access to Wrigley, Southport, parks, theaters, restaurants/bars, as well as multiple public transportation options.

UPPER LEVEL (1st floor)
Features 10' ceilings. 

Kitchen: 15.25' x 12' with granite, fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher, cookware and dining ware. Coffee/tea are also included. SHARED between guests in all 3 rooms.

Living Room: 16' x 15.75, 55" TV w/ cable and wifi, small table. SHARED between guests in all 3 rooms.

Your Bedroom: 13.5' x 7' with Queen bed, reading chair, and closet. PRIVATE room. Note that bedroom doors do NOT lock. 

Bathroom 1: Shower stall, toilet, vanity area. Located off kitchen but PRIVATE bathroom for your usage only. 

LOWER LEVEL (basement): Note the ceilings for the lower level are about 6' high.

Laundry Room: free washer/dryer. SHARED between guests in all 3 rooms.

Bathroom 2: Shower/tub, toilet, vanity area. Shared between guests in the 2 basement bedrooms.

2 additional bedrooms, each with a max of 2 guests..

You'll have a PRIVATE bedroom and bathroom on the 1st floor (not connected), then SHARE the kitchen and living room (on 1st floor) as well as laundry room (in basement) with guests in the 2 other bedrooms. All linens and towels are included.

KEYS There is self-entry anytime from 4pm on. You will be given 1 set of keys for your stay. If keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee.

CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC with a thermostat within the unit. The temperature is kept between 65-70 degrees for the comfort of all guests.

WASHER/DRYER A free washer and dryer are located within the unit. Detergent is also available for your use.

My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I send detailed notes in advance about entry and the unit to ensure smooth logistics; in addition, before and during your stay, I'm more than happy to help with any suggestions or guidance. Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.

The Southport Corridor of Lakeview’s neighborhood has so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Within minutes in a cab, you can be in any of these places.

PARKING 
There is free, public street parking in the area with no permit required. Please note that this means you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. There is also metered parking on a nearby street, and that becomes free from 6pm-9am daily. If you prefer paid parking for your additional vehicles, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city.

CLOSEST STOPS 
o Southport brown train stop: .4 mi, trains go uptown/downtown
o Belmont red/purple/brown trains: .7 mi, trains go uptown/downtown
o 77 bus: across Belmont

Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of card provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket or a re-loadable Ventra card (one-time $5 fee). Multiple people may share a Ventra card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the 1, 3, and 7 day passes can not be shared.

ENTRY
Check-in is at 4pm or later and check-out is by 10am.  You'll be given a custom keypad code to enter the building, then keys will be at a pick-up spot inside the building.

BEDROOM LOCKS
All 3 bedrooms may be locked from the inside but do not have keys to be locked from the outside. All guests trust each other to respect the privacy and personal belongings of others.

NOISE
Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors, and for that reason, we request noise be kept to a reasonable level from 9pm-8am.

CLEANING
The housekeepers clean the unit each time a bedroom turns over. We expect all guests to tidy up after themselves during their stay. In the kitchen, we expect food be kept in designated spaces, counters we wiped after use, dishes etc be placed in dishwasher right away. In the bathrooms, we expect sink/mirror be wiped after use as needed and personal products and towels be stored in bedrooms (we provide a bathroom caddy for convenience).

description:
This cool and spacious 2000 sqft apartment features modern decor, large bedroom, and 2 full bathrooms with amenities, WiFi, cable and parking included. Just blocks from the Lincoln Square restaurant and bar district. Irish Pub located directly below.

- Free Parking 
- 2 full bathrooms with amenities included 
- Free WiFi
- Comcast Cable w/ movie & sports package 
- walking distance to entertainment district 
- Laundry located on site 
- mini fridge in room (on request)
- clean linens provided daily (on request)
- Top 5 safest neighborhood in Chicago 
- Located directly above an Irish Pub

Guests will have full access to all areas of the apartment including living room, kitchen, laundry, 2 full bathrooms, and business center (on request).

- Guest interaction throughout stay
- 2 persons will be present at beginning, during and completion of stay. 
- 2 persons currently live in the apartment in separate bedrooms 
- 3 bedrooms total in apartment, only 2 are occupied. 
Occupants: Male 33 yrs and Female 35 yrs - - Both work full time jobs and are rarely home. 
- A lock and key will be provided for your bedroom for a sense of security 
- You will also be given a key to access the main entrance doors in the apartment
- surveillance cameras in building for safety

- steps from Lincoln Square entertainment district
- several restaurants and bars in area 
- minutes from park
- 1.5 miles from beach
- Free Parking on site
- Located directly above an Irish Pub 
- Top 5 safest neighborhood in Chicago according to Chicago Reader
- short ride to Andersonville restaurant and bar district 
- LGBT friendly area (several bars in area)
- Public Transportation accessible 
- average Uber & Lyft wait times only 3 mins
- short ride to Wrigley Field

- free parking available on site
- Public Transportation easily accessible 
- #92 Foster Bus, #49 Western Bus
- CTA Brown line within walking distance
- CTA Red Line 1.5 miles away via #92 Bus
- Uber and Lyft wait times average 3 mins
- located on busy street easily accessible
house_rules:
- Loud noise and parties are not allowed
- please be respectable 
- treat this as you would your home
- pets are allowed for an additional fee
- must keep pet in room at all times 
- must sign pet waiver upon arrival
- no smoking on premises 
- must smoke outside 15ft ft away from building
- absolutely no drugs!!!!
- alcohol is ok (must be 21+over) 
- You may cook and use microwave
- cookware, plates and utensils are provided
- maximum of 2 guests total per stay
- additional guests are not allowed 
- Irish Pub available downstairs for guests 
- free private event space available in bar
- inquire within for hosting an event in bar

description:
A delightful experience to live in Chicago! Conveniently located only 17 miles from O'Hare International Airport, a 10 minutes walk from Skydeck, Cloud Gate,Art Institute of Chicago & also close to the major subways and train lines for you to explore all the good points of the city. Studio with open concept,complete kitchen,beautiful living room and stocked bathroom. Wifi and Netflix on the TV, next to great restaurants, bars, concerts, museums, theaters, nightlife and more. 
BOOK TODAY!

This luxury apartment is equipped with a king size bed that can comfortably accommodate two people, a large sofa, and a flat screen TV for your entertainment that already has the Netflix streaming. This apartment is the ideal place to come home to after a long day of exploring Chicago.
Cozy and efficient, the kitchen will be stocked with basic cookware for when you are tired of dining out. You will also find a coffee machine, toaster, electric kettle and microwave. 
Linens, towels, and bathroom amenities will be provided. Our property provide you with the comfort and confidence of a home.
The entire studio is connected through Wi-Fi high speed and has air conditioning & heating.

Guest bedroom, bathrooms, living room and kitchen, and the building the laundry area.

Entire Private Apartment.
The check-in is always after 3:00 pm, until midnight.

Many thanks for considering staying at this studio.
 We are sure you will have a great time here and we hope that we are able to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

description:
Big Cozy Apartment in the heart of Lakeview, High Speed WiFi , TV w/ Amazon Fire & Netflix. Kitchen with Induction Cooktop, microwave, coffee maker, Oven/toaster. Free Washer & dryer in the building. Backyard features shared outdoor pool with slate deck. Walk to everything! Whole Foods 2min walk, Southport Corridor, Wrigley, tons of restaurants, shopping, entertainment, and services. Great access to CTA Red/Brown/Purple line trains, and Buses. 3rd floor unit. (Please note Shower high 5.8 feet)

Lakeview
Share this post:
Why we love it
Lakeview’s laidback atmosphere and picture-perfect shoreline make it a favorite hang out among locals. And spots like lively Wrigleyville and the Belmont Theater District make it a major entertainment hub, too.

Insider tips
Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east, Lakeview melds several distinct areas — East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown, and Wrigleyville. Each spot has its own unique character, but they’re all pulled together by Lakeview’s casual, welcoming feel.

Hit the bustling shopping districts along Broadway in East Lakeview, along Belmont near Boystown, and the bustling Southport Corridor for local boutiques, record shops, and vintage treasure hunting. Or live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless array of bars and pubs, and the dozens of much-loved neighborhood restaurants that lie in between.

Lakeview is also known as a go-to for arts and culture — you’ll find live music venues, summer street festivals, and a thriving theatre, dance, and comedy scene. Blue Man Group is a world-famous troupe that brings music, comedy, and performance art together in one unforgettable show (if you’re sitting in the “Splash Zone”, you’ll want to put on that waterproof poncho).

On a nice day, walk east until you hit Lake Michigan. That’s where you’ll find a 1,200-acre outdoor oasis, featuring the scenic Lakefront Trail, a golf course and driving range, a boat harbor, tennis courts, and grassy fields perfect for picnicking.

Explore like a local
Grab a cup of award-winning coffee, and maybe splurge on a custom-made cruiser, at Heritage Bicycles. Enjoy craft beer, a live organist, and vintage surroundings at the Music Box Theatre. Visit the museum-like showroom at Chicago Music Exchange for a tour of one of the world’s premier vintage guitar collections.

access: Our guests have access to our lobby lounge area, library with a complimentary business center, a boutique shop and a snack bar.
description:
Our suites are perfect for families or individuals, traveling for business or pleasure. The Guesthouse Hotel offers great style, comfort and value in the unique Andersonville neighborhood. Stay with us and Live Like a Local!

The large, fully equipped gourmet kitchen and dining area make this unit ideal for hosting a family gathering for the holidays, or just a weekend getaway with the girlfriends.  The unit is spacious enough to accommodate up to 6 people.   

Library and Club Room are available to book for events, contact for details and pricing.

Our guests have access to our lobby lounge area, library with a complimentary business center, a boutique shop and a snack bar.

24 Hour Front Desk.

Our location puts us at the border of three vibrant Chicago neighborhoods - Andersonville, Uptown and Lincoln Square.  These neighborhoods each have their own distinctive feel, and are full of eclectic restaurants, independently-owned small businesses and other attractions.  We are within walking distance to famous Chicago destinations including the Green Mill, Aragon Ballroom, Riviera Theater.  Wrigley Field is a short bus ride away, and the popular beaches of Lake Michigan are within a mile from our doors.

The nearest CTA Red line train station (Lawrence stop) is less than a 10 minute walk away, and we are located on the route of several bus lines, including the Clark 22 bus route.  Taxis are easily hailed along Clark Street.

Dog friendly.  Baby and toddler items for families (by requests): high chair, pack n' play, bath kit, etc.

Afternoon Tea available by Vanille Patisserie. Contact us for details
house_rules:
For guests with a profile that is 
1. less than one month old 
or  
2. who have no reviews 
We will take a $250 Credit Card HOLD upon check in

Front Desk available 24 hours/day to get keys.
Check In: 4:00pm - 11:30pm
Check Out: 10:00 am
Garage parking available: $24+tax per vehicle
Valid Photo ID required to pick up keys.
Please provide name of all guests upon check-in.
No smoking in the room, on the balcony or anywhere on the premises Quiet Hours (9:00pm-9:00am) to respect our guests.

description:
Located in Pilsen, a lively neighborhood within 2 miles of McCormick Convention Center and minutes away from Downtown and the parks. Not to mention the easiest access to both major highways making traveling north or south the shortest distance.
2400 sq ft. of exposed brick and wood loft has tons of natural lighting, comfortable seating areas and all the coffee your heart can desire!
Nothing but great vibes in this place. Fit for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers!

The space
-Industrial style loft 
-Private bedroom area with desk, living room area and very large deck with views of the infamous SEARS tower (Willis, for out-of-towners)
-Killer furniture (comfortable too!), curated antiquities, art, and plants
- Kitchen stocked with everything you will need to enjoy all three meals of the day
-Endless amounts of natural lighting/shades for all that light
-Maintained cleanliness/minimalism at its best
-Planted in a vibrant arts neighborhood featuring bars, lounges, authentic Mexican and Chinese food and some of the city’s best restaurants

Myself or Shawn will be there daily from morning til mid afternoon and some nights as well. Always available by text

Rated as on of the top 12 neighborhoods in the WORLD (Google - Forbes 12 Coolest Neighborhoods), Pilsen is a vibrant, authentic, arts neighborhood, centrally located to get everywhere in Chicago in the shortest amount of time

Chicago is big city, very wide and spread out. I personally recommend renting a car (free street parking all around the neighborhood) or Ubering around city if you want to save on time. If you prefer to save on money the Chicago public transit is very convenient and all around.   Only a 2 Minute walk to 8 / 18 Buses on Halsted
Red/Blue/ Orange Lines , 15-20 minutes walking
From Midway 40 Minutes on public transit
From O'hare 1 Hour on public transit

additional_house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee

access: You'll have full access to my 2 bedroom, 1 bath condo.
description:
**32+ night stays** My 2 bedroom Bucktown loft is in a converted warehouse, and its past life as an industrial space comes through - despite updated appliances and finishes - thanks to brick walls and timber framing. The two bedrooms are on opposite sides of the condo, which makes it ideal for all types of travelers, and my place is perfectly located whether you're trying to get a feel for the neighborhood before taking the plunge on moving nearby, or here for work in the Loop - book today!

The open living/kitchen/dining space separates the two queen sized bedrooms, and the entire condo features exposed duct work and brick walls. Windows overlook a lively Bucktown street and let in plenty of natural light.

You'll have full access to my 2 bedroom, 1 bath condo.

One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

We're just steps to the Damen and Fullerton buses, and a 15 minute walk to the Clybourn Metra station - you won't have any trouble getting around town without a car from here! If you do bring your car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.
house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee

access:
The kitchen is fully equipped.  You can do everything from make a quick cup of coffee with the Keurig to whipping up your favorite slurpie in the NutriBullet to making an egg and some bacon.  There are pots, pans, utensils and plates if you decide you want to cook for yourself instead of checking out the local eateries.  

The picture window in the living room is great for early morning sunrises.  If you do yoga first thing or start your day with prayer you’ll appreciate the view and the lack of neighbors.  Unit located at top of hill overlooking housing 40 feet below, so no one to peep into your front window.  

There are three air conditioners in the unit.  Each bedroom has a window A/C and there is a wall A/C in the living room/dining room.  The kitchen, dining room and the smaller bedroom also have ceiling fans for those in-between days.  All the windows open and are screened.  

Clean recently remodeled kitchen and bathroom.  Step-down living room complete with TV, Roku and DVD player.  Small desk for working with laptop, high speed WiFi. Printer available also.  

Electronic locks allow you easy and safe entrance to your unit.  

There is a washer and dryer in the basement of the building for a small charge.  

Parking is free and off street.  

Guests have access to patio with charcoal grill, fire pit and comfortable seating when the weather permits.
description:
Sunny, quiet first floor 2 bedroom apartment in owner occupied 4-Flat apartment building.  It is located in the Southwest corner of Chicago’s Cook County.  [Note to traveling nurses: owner is a retired physician & long term stays are available.]  

The building's eastern view overlooks the southern suburbs of Chicago Ridge, Oak Lawn and Bridgeview.

First floor unit.  5 stairs up from ground level.  

One King Size bed in Master bedroom; twin bunk beds in 2nd bedroom. Additional beds available, including Queen mattress can be added if you need.

The kitchen is fully equipped.  You can do everything from make a quick cup of coffee with the Keurig to whipping up your favorite slurpie in the NutriBullet to making an egg and some bacon.  There are pots, pans, utensils and plates if you decide you want to cook for yourself instead of checking out the local eateries.  

The picture window in the living room is great for early morning sunrises.  If you do yoga first thing or start your day with prayer you’ll appreciate the view and the lack of neighbors.  Unit located at top of hill overlooking housing 40 feet below, so no one to peep into your front window.  

There are three air conditioners in the unit.  Each bedroom has a window A/C and there is a wall A/C in the living room/dining room.  The kitchen, dining room and the smaller bedroom also have ceiling fans for those in-between days.  All the windows open and are screened.  

Clean recently remodeled kitchen and bathroom.  Step-down living room complete with TV, Roku and DVD player.  Small desk for working with laptop, high speed WiFi. Printer available also.  

Electronic locks allow you easy and safe entrance to your unit.  

There is a washer and dryer in the basement of the building for a small charge.  

Parking is free and off street.  

Guests have access to patio with charcoal grill, fire pit and comfortable seating when the weather permits.

I live in and own the building.  I'm available if you need directions, recommendations or are having a problem with the space.  If you are arriving late I will be here to let you in.

Within walking distance (3 blocks or less):  Small shopping center with everything from groceries to dry cleaning to breakfast and casual dining to a gas station to local pizza parlor, Walgreens Drug store, beauty salon, nail salon and Mexican restaurant.  Ours is a neighborhood of homes and apartment buildings two blocks south of a main business thorough fare.  It is peaceful, quiet and clean area.  

Sammy's is great for breakfast, Xando's has some of the best food around and they make the best Egg/Lemon soup you'll ever taste.  

 At the end of our block is the entrance to the Robert Humphrey's Memorial Horseback Riding Trail.  It's the beginning of 100 miles of county forest preserve hiking, biking and horseback riding trails.    Yes, Cook County has an extensive array of trails and one entrance is just down the block.  

One & 1/2 mile south:   Moraine Valley Community College (17,000+ students from all over the world).

Within a 15 minute drive:  Midway Airport; Christ Hospital; Palos Community Hospital; Trinity College; St. Xavier College; Chicago Ridge Mall; Orland Park Mall; Toyota Park (home of the Chicago Fire soccer team); Burr Ridge Mall; and 1.25 miles East a golf course with 9 and 18 holes. There are all manners of churches from Greek Orthodox to Baptist to Islamic Mosques here also.  Want Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Marianno's or Pete's Fresh Market (they all carry organics and world foods)?  They are each within 10-20 minutes from the building.  

Within 30 minute drive:  O’Hare Airport; McCormick Place; Soldier Field; Chicago’s Loop; Oak Brook Mall; Yorktown Mall.

For visiting Nurses:  Christ Hospital, Little Company of Mary and Palos Community Hospital are all within a 15 minute drive of this building.  Other major area hospitals, Joliet, Good Sam, etc. are within 30 minutes.  

Interstate I-55 and the Illinois Tollway I-294 are minutes away.  Bus service to all of the area is available one block from building.  We enjoy Uber service and Enterprise Car rentals has an office a few miles from our building on 95th Street.

This is a non-smoking space.  Pets can be accommodated, but must be cleaned up after.  Dogs that bark are not acceptable as there are other residents in the building.  We can talk about this when you make your reservation.  Noise must be kept down after 9:30 pm until 9:00 am as some residents work different shifts.  This is definitely not a party house.

If you use my wifi network, you agree to use it only for legal purposes and you promise not to use it for illegal uploading, downloading, or any other illegal activities.

access: Guests will have access to the shared living room, dining room and bath.
description:
The Honeyroom is a private room in The Honeycomb Hideout; this home is a well-appointed historic Chicago Bungalow in the heart of the South Shore neighborhood. The space is great for overnight and extended in-town stays for work or leisure. Nearby attractions include the Museum of Science and Industry, Hyde Park casual and fine restaurants, the South Shore Golf Course and easy-access to Lake Michigan.

Your accommodations include a comfortable double-bed in a private room, a shared bathroom and Netflix and Cable is set-up in the shared living room. A selection of DVDs are also available in your private room.

Guests will have access to the shared living room, dining room and bath.

I will be in and out of the Honeycomb and certainly will help make your stay a memorable one. Message me for any questions or concerns.

The South Shore neighborhood is rich with beautiful architecture, a golf course, near Lake Michigan and will be home to the Obama Presidential Center in 2020. Check out the Osaka Garden in nearby Hyde Park and the Museum of Science and Industry. Famed casual and fine dining is plentiful in Hyde Park and is a short ways away.

Here at the Honeycomb, you are steps from public transit that will take you downtown in roughly 20 minutes by bus. Uber and Lyft are good options for transit as well. Free street parking is available too!

Check-out is at 10AM.

additional_house_rules:
- Due to local laws or HOA requirements, guests must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation.
- 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.
- The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation.
- All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m.
- If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee.
- No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises.
- No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected.
- Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur during occupancy.
- Due to local laws, regulations, or Homeowner Association rules, guests may be required to agree to additional terms of service. 
- Property Specific terms: ADDITIONAL RENTAL TERMS FOR THE GRAND PLAZA BUILDING
1. Minimum Age.  You certify that you are at least 25 years of age. You agree to be legally responsible for the compliance of all occupants of the Condo with these Grand Plaza Additional Terms, and that anyone younger than 25 is accompanied by a parent or guardian. You agree that you intend to personally occupy the Condo for the full duration of the period for which you have rented this Condo.
2. Maximum Occupancy. You agree that at no time during the period you have rented the home will daytime or overnight occupancy exceed the posted maximum occupancy of 6 persons. Only the guests listed below are authorized to be in the home during the rental period.  Failure to conform to the occupancy requirements of the Vacation Home is a violation of the Code.
3. Noise and Disruptive Activity.  You agree to conduct yourselves in a manner that is respectful of neighbors by, among other things, refraining from making unduly loud or unnecessary outdoor noises, engaging disorderly conduct or any other activity that could interfere with the quiet enjoyment of neighbors or the community. Quiet Hours are enforced between 10pm ad 8am.
4. Specific breeds are not allowed on the property: Rottweiler, Doberman, German Shepherd, Pit Bull, American Bulldog, American Staffordshire Terrier, Bull Terrier, Chow, Wolf Breeds, or any mix of the aforementioned breeds, and any breed that relates to security or guard dogs. description:
This property is a 1210  square feet,  2 Bedroom, 2 bathroom accommodation located in Chicago.  Dog-friendly suite w/ balcony, lake views, & shared pool, gym, saunas & more! offers 1 King bed, 1 Queen bed. It can host 6 people.  This accommodation features washer/dryer. Please see the description below or inquire for more details!

Soak in skyline and lake views from the 45th floor at this two-bedroom Chicago suite, a modern Grand Plaza escape with a large balcony, an ideal River North location, and fantastic building amenities that include a pool, saunas, a running track, and a fitness center.

This 1,210-square-foot retreat sits on the 45th floor of the Grand Plaza, an upscale high-rise on State Street and Grand Avenue in the heart of River North. Find endless shopping opportunities on Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile three blocks east, conduct a bit of business in The Loop five blocks south, and unwind with a long walk or a sunset boat tour on the Chicago River four blocks south.

With 24-hour building security and 50,000 square feet of shared recreational space, this suite offers a comfortable getaway for business travelers or a group of friends exploring Chicago for the first time. Come home from a day out on the town to browse the free WiFi, watch a DVD or a bit of cable TV, or fix a few snacks in the kitchen (with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances) to enjoy on the balcony with a view of the city and Lake Michigan. Or, head downstairs to check out the building's outdoor pool, grilling area, running track, gym, basketball court, game room, saunas, and steam rooms. At night, you'll find a foldable queen mattress cushion available in addition to the beds. The family dog is also welcome to join you for an additional nightly fee.

You won't find a more convenient home base in all of Chicago - reserve your stay at this Grand Plaza getaway today!

*Outdoor pool open Memorial Day-Labor Day (Weather Permitting)

* Please be aware that all guests must be at least 25 years of age unless accompanied by parent or legal guardian.

* Has the max occupancy of 6 but sleeps 4 comfortably 

**PARKING IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE COST OF YOUR STAY** 
There is a parking garage on the bottom floor of this building, but guests are responsible for the cost. Guests bringing vehicles will need to purchase parking passes from LAZ Parking.

City of Chicago License #2209850

- 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.
- The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation.
- All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m.
- If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee.
- No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises.
- No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected.
- Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur during occupancy.

access: Guests will have full access and use of the house 24 hours a day. You can come and go as you like and there’s an electronic lock, so there are no keys to keep up with!
description:
Beautiful home in Chicago north suburb IL 5 beds (4 bedrooms), 2 full baths.Beautiful home recently rehabbed. Great location walking distance to restaurants and shops. Near the train and highway easy access to get to downtown chicago. Full kitchen with fridge, stove, microwave, coffee maker and all the amenities. Central heat and ac. . Full finished basement. Everything is here. Plenty of free parking. TV fire stick watch any live channel you want.

Stay in a private single family house, The house has a full kitchen with all the amenities, 4 bedrooms with 5 queen size beds, 2 couches, and 3 additional air mattresses for more guests, 2 full baths, living room, a lovely backyard and a private basement. Plenty of free parking.

Guests will have full access and use of the house 24 hours a day. You can come and go as you like and there’s an electronic lock, so there are no keys to keep up with!

It’s likely you won’t see me during your stay, which allows you more privacy and convenience. However, I am here anytime you need to reach out. If you need anything or have questions, just send me a message via Airbnb and I’ll be quick to respond.

access: You have a kitchenette, with microwave, mini fridge & hotplate, coffee pot & tea kettle! Full sized washer & dryer. Full bath with both a tub & gorgeous walk in shower. Dining room table. Sleeper sofa. Desk & office chair. 3 bedrooms with queen sized beds.
description:
Unwind and enjoy the city in our Cozy and Clean Guest Suite! 

We're new hosts on Airbnb and super excited to begin having guests stay at our recently furnished guest space. 

We live in the main, separable part of the property and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city!

3 bedroom, 1 bath + sleeper sofa! You have access to the full basement so plenty of privacy. Just steps away from easy to use public transportation! Lots of parks in the area & small coffee shops to check out! Great area to explore.

You have a kitchenette, with microwave, mini fridge & hotplate, coffee pot & tea kettle! Full sized washer & dryer. Full bath with both a tub & gorgeous walk in shower. Dining room table. Sleeper sofa. Desk & office chair. 3 bedrooms with queen sized beds.

We live onsite, so we are close by should you need anything! We are easy to contact, by phone call, text or through the Airbnb app.

Close to public transportation, parks, CVS, 7-11 and some small restaurants.

Public transportation is the most affordable way to get around as parking can sometimes be a little difficult when you want to explore!

access: The entire first floor apartment and backyard
description:
Our comfortable and spacious 2 bedroom, first floor apartment is located in Ukrainian Village, steps away from great restaurants, clubs and shops. The neighborhood includes many architectural charms including, Holy Trinity Russian Orthodox Church designed by Louis Sullivan located right behind our place. Wicker Park and Bucktown, the 606 Trail, sidewalk cafes, shops, and bars surround us. We are 10 mins from downtown Chicago.

You'll walk into an open space with large rooms, 10' ceilings, tall windows and a vintage look. The front room, parlor, dining room are all original to the house. There are two bedrooms, both with Queen sized beds. Its sunny and bright and features an old fashioned front porch, perfect for people and dog watching!


City registration #R19000038318

The entire first floor apartment and backyard

When you arrive and when you need us

Its a lovely residential landmark district featuring original architecture, tree lined streets and friendly neighbors.  Coffee shops, fresh pastries and great food are only steps away.  We are located just 1/2 a block from Presence Saints Mary and Elizabeth Medical Center and Ukrainian Villages best pubs.

The bus stop is only a block away and the 'El' elevated (Blue line) train is only .8 of a mile from the front door.  Street parking is available on most days and when tight, a spot can be located by circling the block a few times. This neighborhood is very walkable.  When weather permits, walk.  Its a great place to explore!

Bon Appetit Names Chicago 'Restaurant City of the Year' 

“Chicago is clearly America’s most exciting city to eat in right now,” Bon Appetit's Special Projects Editor Julia Kramer said. “I can’t remember a time that I’ve been as psyched to eat there as I’ve been this year.

description:
This is a 1 bedroom basement in law apartment. Cozy and can sleep up to 3 people

The entire unit is yours to use. Feel free gym equipment, washer and dryer just not past 9pm please

There are permanent renters upstairs a family.

Located in a quiet diverse area. Near the Stephenson convention center, Rosemont outlet mall, and 7 mins away from O’hare International airport.

Best way of transport is through Uber if going to convention center or local sights.

Note*** there is a dog on the premises, please do not be alarmed if you hear her bark upon entering the door. If you see her, just knock on first floor front door to let them know to put pup away. 
Thank you!

description:
Minutes from Rush University Medical Center and UIC, this home is tucked away in the hidden gem of the "Heart of Chicago" neighborhood. The Loop is located just 5 miles away while McCormick Place is accessible by a 20-minute direct bus ride.

Your room is bright and airy with a comfy bed dressed in fresh sheets, fluffy pillows and snuggly blankets. If you are the culinary kind, our kitchen has all the tools you'll need for you to feel right at home. Your bathroom is shared.

Details:
– Twin bed
– Fresh linens and towels
– Shared bath
– Free WiFi
– On-street parking
– Use of washer / dryer
– Full use of gourmet kitchen
– Access to front balcony

* Please note that this room does not have a closet. However, there is plenty of room under the bed for your luggage and hooks on the door for hanging.

Your hosts are yogis who practice regularly. (We will do our best to keep the meditating to a purr while your are catching your zzzzs.) If you are a kind and honest person you will be in good company.

We look forward to hosting you in this most amazing city. While the architecture is incredible and the food is world-reknown, what makes this city unique are its people. Welcome to Chicago.

"Heart of Chicago" has a rich ethnic heritage.  Established at the end of the 19th century, it was first inhabited by the Bohemian working class. Since then it has experienced the richness of an Italian population and more recently Hispanic. Our house is right around the corner from a handful of some of the remaining old school Italian restaurants and taquerias can be found on most corners.

Transportation:
– 7 minute walk to the Pink Line, Damen stop
– 6 train stops from the Loop 
– easy access to the Damen and Western Avenues bus lines 
– 1 mi. from I-55, 2.5 mi. from I-290
– On street parking available

Conveniences: 
– 1 block away from Heart of Chicago Italian restaurants 
– > 1 mi. from Pete's Fresh Market 
– 1 mi. from Target
– 2.5 mi. from Rush University Medical Center 
– 3.5 mi. from UIC

Meow:
There is a cat on the premises who keeps to himself. While his people are gifted in the art of hospitality, he airs on the side of hiss-pitality. He is not aggressive but is shy with new people.

Crisp:
In the colder months this room is cool. There are extra blankets and a space heater to take the nip out of the air.

May-October:
This room is the only way to access the hanging baskets off of the balcony. Please note that if you are staying during the above months, there will be light traffic through your room for watering the flowers and keeping your surroundings lush.
house_rules:
No smoking on the premises.
No additional guests.
No open flame in the room.
Night-entry into the home should be peaceful.

description:
Large and spacious two bedroom, 1.5 bath located right off Sheridan, and a block away from the lake. 20 minutes ride downtown Chicago!

Two queen sized bed, a fully equipped kitchen, 1 full bath, and an extra restroom in the master bedroom.A perfect spot to relax after a hard day touring or attending local functions.
Perfectly nested between the cities buzz and the suburbs of Evanston; 10mins to the Loyola University and Northwestern; 20mins to downtown, and two blocks away from the lake!
Your comfort is important to me, so make sure you contact me for anything you need!

You will have access to the entire apartment. The space is entirely yours to reside in.

Lake,Public Transport right into downtown,Loyola and Northwestern Universities

Metra and CTA Bus Stop less than 5 minutes walk

-Strict no party or event policy enforced at this property.
-No smoking
-Not suitable for pets

access: 24 hour access to the entire house. Come and go as you please.
description:
ENTIRE  3 bedroom HOUSE - large & comfortable with full kitchen. FREE  Parking for  2 CARS  One (Green Line)  train stop to United Center - Concerts, Bulls & Blackhawk games. Two stops to trendy West Loop Randolph bars, restaurants and shops. 10 minute ride downtown Chicago. Kitchen has all cooking utensils including coffee,, cream, sugar, spices,pans &  dishes . Shampoo Conditioner & Laundry soap &  towels are  provided. Free wi-fi  NO SMOKING ANYWHERE - IF YOU SMOKE WE ARE NOT A GOOD FIT.

You will be staying in the entire home! This historic 1886 Chicago Row house has 2 floors with a large back deck and small yard in a residential neighborhood. Two bedrooms have king size hotel quality mattresses with delux bedding. Very comfortable. The third bedroom has bunk beds. All rooms have dresser space and closets. Six people will be very comfortable. If there are more than 6 guests then we can provide an air mattress to put in the largest bedroom for an additional 2 people.   Also 2 secured parking spaces FOR SMALL TO MEDIUM CARS (or one large vehicle)  and  free street parking in front of the house - no permit needed. You have access to the entire home including additional laundry room on lower level. Complimentary Wi-fi is   included.

24 hour access to the entire house. Come and go as you please.

I will always be available to answer any questions or concerns if you message me on AirBnB.  I live next door and I  look forward to sharing any information I can provide regarding your stay in Chicago!

Before you book please read the reviews to ensure this location meets your travel style.  I work very hard to provide a clean affordable place to stay. However this is NOT the trendy West Loop area. This is a gentrifying neighborhood.  We do have a  very large multinational Fresh Food Market a few blocks from the house, some fast food and a pharmacy. We do NOT  have any trendy cafes or restaurants within walking distance, however we do boarder the trendy West Loop neighborhood and we are ONE BLOCK WALK TO  THE GREEN LINE TRAIN with  ONE TRAIN STOP  to  many Chicago attractions including the United Center, Union Park,  and the West Loop -  Randolph Street restaurants bars and shopping.  10 minutes Train ride to downtown Chicago and the Theater District/Michigan. 
So please please do not book and  rate us 2 stars for location. If you prefer to be right in the West Loop neighborhood look east on the map. This is a large, nice, clean, affordable, alternative to pricey neighborhoods if you are ok with not walking directly to Chicago attractions and your travel style allows for a gentrifying  city neighborhood.  See "getting around" info.

We are very centrally located. Uber and Lyft provide very reasonable options to travel to many close neighborhoods such as the Loop,  West Town, West Loop, Ukrainian Village, Wicker Park and Bucktown. This is the best option in the evening, especially with 4 or more people.  You are a $10 ride from many tourist attractions.   We are a few blocks from I-290 expressway. We are one block to CTA Green line "L" train with one stop to Union Park, one stop to the United Center and 2 stops to the  West Loop . You are a 12 minute Train ride ( 3 stops) to downtown Chicago Loop , Michigan Avenue , Grant Park and Millennium Park and the Lake.  We are located 3 miles west of Lake Michigan. 

Airports
Ohare and Midway are about a half hour ride ( pending traffic) 
and cost about $20. Also easy by public transportation. 

Ohare - is Blue Line ( follow signs for trains to city) Transfer at State & Lake to Green line and get off at California stop .  

Midway  is Orange line. Transfer at State and Lake  to Green line and off at California stop. 

We are 2 block  walk from California Green line train stop. 

I AM HAPPY TO ANSWER ANY TRAVEL QUESTIONS!

We do not host  parties or events and no guests that are not on reservation.  This is a residential neighborhood. If you live in Chicago please message me before instant booking. We also ask that Guests   be 21 years old to book and have a current picture on their profile. NO smoking in the home. Outside back only/cigarettes. We also have cameras OUTSIDE the front and back doors. No inside:)
house_rules:
I sincerely hope you enjoy your stay.  Friendly reminder check out is 10am. We kindly ask that you
- Wash dishes or use dishwasher & empty your trash before departure ( trash bins behind fence in back yard) 
-All used towels go in white basket in bedroom closet
Cleaning service will handle linens. Please leave on beds. 
Safe Travels!

access: Kitchen and dining room
description:
Own bedroom and own private bathroom available for short term stay in 2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms private condo in Hyde Park area 1.5 miles from the University of Chicago. There is street parking and it's close to bus lines into the downtown 25 minutes away. 10 minutes bus ride to 69th-Street Red-line Subway or "EL” stop. You have your own Europen style bathroom, which is off the kitchen and has a fully functioning bathtub but no bath curtain. Quiet male professional lives in the flat.

Kitchen, dining room and living room

Kitchen and dining room

Close to downtown Hyde Park, Science museum, University of Chicago, Jefferson Park, and site of the new Obama Library

Street parking available, 10 minutes bus ride to 69th-Street Red-line Subway or "EL” stop. 20-minute uber ride

description:
The entire basement is up for rent. There are two beds in the space to sleep two, a full bathroom, a living room, a dining room area and washer and dryer, private parking. It is a lovely private space with its own entrance. You will enter the house and then be able to go down to the basement through a private door. The kitchen is shared with the rest of the house. You will also have access to the dining and living rooms on the first floor.

You can relax and watch Netflix in your own private setting.

Very quiet and residential neighborhood.

There is a bus stop a few minutes walk from the home. There is also a bus stop in walking distance to Old Orchard Mall.

access: Guests have access to the building's fitness center.
description:
Please note that although the furniture is the same, the layout of the living room and kitchen will differ slightly in your unit! Pictures are of a similar Domio unit in the building.

Experience can't-miss city views in this 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment near Navy Pier. Here you’ll find all the comforts of home: full kitchen, custom artwork, and furnishings curated to reflect the beauty of the Windy City.

This space exemplifies the Domio standard: uncompromising style and maximum comfort. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath apartment boasts a radiant living room, exquisite furniture, and premium finishes. In addition to a fully-stocked kitchen with professional-grade appliances, guests will be pleased to find hand-picked artwork throughout the home. Each bedroom has a queen bed and there is a sofa bed in the living room.

Guests have access to the building's fitness center.

There’s no need for us to get in your way of having a good time. If you need anything though - questions, recommendations, or just want to chat - our Domio delighters are always one phone call away!

Streeterville is one of Chicago's most walkable neighborhoods and you'll be steps from the famed Navy Pier which is only a 6 minute walk away. Easily walk to restaurants and bars to truly experience Chicago.

Safety is our top priority!  To maintain a safe community for our guests, neighbors, and team members, we do conduct a background screening check for all reservations prior to your stay.  This screening includes checking the National Criminal & OFAC Database for felonies and the National Sex Offender Registry.  If you have any questions about this process, please contact us.

Also please note that we cannot accept bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.

Chicago Registration Number: Pending

Thank you again for choosing Domio!

access: This listing is for the entire 2nd floor apartment of our building.  You will have the whole apartment to yourself.
description: Our family apartment will welcome you with all the amenities needed for your Chicago visit. Located in the heart of Little Italy, easy 5 min. walk to restaurants, bars, Starbucks, parks & playgrounds, UIC Pavilion & Medical District. Only 2 blocks to subway (Blue line, Racine stop) which takes you directly downtown to all major attractions including The Art Institute, Millennium Park, Michigan Ave, theatre district, lakefront and so much more. We are only 2.5 miles from the lakefront if you prefer to walk.
house_rules: - Please be respectful of others in the building. No loud music or parties after 10pm, please. Thank you!
interaction: Our  Airbnb's are self-service, so you will have your independence and privacy while staying with us.  But should you need any assistance we can easily be reached through the Airbnb app.  Our primary residence is located on the 3rd floor of our building so when we aren't traveling you may spot us coming in and out of the building.  When we are traveling we make our primary residence also available on Airbnb: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6625214
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the lively Little Italy neighborhood. Walk to eateries, coffee shops, parks, and playgrounds. There's easy access to downtown, Greektown, Pilsen, and Chinatown. It's steps from the University of Illinois campus and Rush Hospital.
notes: For guests needing parking, complimentary guest parking permits for on-street parking will be provided. We can also arrange housekeeping service for an additional fee for stays longer than a week.
space:
Located on the 2nd floor of our building, this sunny & bright apartment offers plenty of space for you to make the most of your visit to the Windy City. Our kitchen is basic but ready for your cooking needs, should you choose to make your own meals. The open floor living space features a dining area, as well as a comfy couch that doubles as a lounger and also turns into a huge bed.  There is also a flat screen TV with Netflix & Roku. The space also features a desk for your laptop or writing needs and a USB charging station for your convenience. 

For families, we have games, toys & legos to help entertain any kiddos, as well as books throughout the apt for adults and kids alike.

The main bedroom offers a brand new and comfortable queen bed and plenty of closet space. The 2nd bedroom features two new comfortable twin beds. The recently updated bathroom is equipped with a tiled shower & plenty of storage for your toiletries. You will also find a backyard with seating, table & umbrella for all to enjoy al-fresco dining on warm summer nights.
summary: Our family apartment will welcome you with all the amenities needed for your Chicago visit. Located in the heart of Little Italy, easy 5 min. walk to restaurants, bars, Starbucks, parks & playgrounds, UIC Pavilion & Medical District. Only 2 blocks to subway (Blue line, Racine stop) which takes you directly downtown to all major attractions including The Art Institute, Millennium Park, Michigan Ave, theatre district, lakefront and so much more. We are only 2.5 miles from the lakefront if you prefer to walk.
transit: We are two blocks to the blue line on the EL train, which goes directly to downtown/loop area as well as to O'Hare International airport. This line will also take you directly to the very hip neighborhood of Wicker Park with great people watching and wonderful restaurants, bars & shopping. There is also easy access to the bus lines.

access:
We have a nice backyard with table chairs and grill that is open for all to use. 
The coin operated laundry is in the back and the garden suite has the easiest access to it.
description:
Per the City of Chicago Laws & Ordinances, 31 night minimum on all stays. A great 2 bedroom Garden Suite in the artsy/Mexican neighborhood of Pilsen. Just minutes away from the medical district and next to the Pink line stop for quick access to downtown. It has two large bedrooms with closets, long open kitchen and living room.

A great place for those extended visits, you will feel right at home with a good spring mattress beds, dressers, night stands with bedside lights and all the things you need for cooking.  
We are so close to public transportation that you will be spoiled with how quickly you can get to downtown and back to home to rest.  We also have a great little coffee shop at the station.

We have a nice backyard with table chairs and grill that is open for all to use. 
The coin operated laundry is in the back and the garden suite has the easiest access to it.

We live upstairs so we are always available for questions, recommendations or just plain good ole conversations. We always respond pretty quickly to issues and having owned the building for quite some time have become pretty handy so we can take care of most repairs.

All the great restaurants and bars are on 18th street and all walking distance. We also have a cool small bar just around the corner, which is great for getting some drinks with a friend when you don't want to travel too far but still want to get out. There are great little local grocery stores, but we also have a Target a short bus ride south (if you didnt want to walk there) and we have an ALDI a short walking distance. 
We are close to UIC as well as a short bus ride to the United Center and to Chinatown!

We are close to two major expressways I55 and I290.
I55 goes into Downtown and out to Bolingbrook, Argonne National Laboratory, and all the way to Springfield (southwest).
I290 goes into Downtown and out west Chicago Premium Outlet Mall, Aurora and to Dekalb (west). 
If you are sticking around town, you can just take the Pink Line to Medical District or Downtown.  We also have the 18th bus that can take you to south loop and the Museum Campus/Soldier Field or take the Damen bus to United Center or to Wicker Park!

We have plenty of street parking as well as parking in the alley.

description: The Single Studio is ideal for solo travelers looking for a comfortable and convenient stay in the Windy City. The One Passenger Studio comes fully furnished with one twin bed, a ready-to-use kitchen a kitchen equipped with silverware, dinnerware, cookware and basic appliances like a coffee maker. Also enjoy a TV set, and free, high-speed Wi-Fi. This is a pet-friendly apartment, so if your pet insists on joining you on your trip, for a small fee you're welcome to bring them along! You'll feel like you're flying first class when you stay at the Ginosi 747 Apartel in Chicago.

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.

access: You'll have full access to my one-bedroom apartment.
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

My (recently redecorated!) one bedroom actually has two beds - and the day bed is very comfortable! I'm only a couple of miles from the Loop, so this is a great location whether you're in town for business or to see the sights (Navy Pier is only a few miles east.) The neighborhood itself is vibrant, with plenty of restaurants and shops, and I'm close to the Blue and Green lines. What a location! Book today!

You'll enter - via private entrance - into an open living room / kitchen. In a nook off the kitchen is the day bed. Down the hall is the Queen-sized bedroom, full bathroom, and washer and dryer.

You'll have full access to my one-bedroom apartment.

This apartment is located in West Town, an area just northwest of the Loop. It was originally part of Chicago's famous Polish Downtown. Because of this, it has a community vibe and is full of rich history. Shops, restaurants, and bars are within walking distance of the apartment. Other nearby neighborhoods include River West and Noble Square.

There are several bus lines located on the adjacent Ashland Avenue and Chicago Avenue. The Chicago Ave (Blue line) train stop and Ashland (Green/Pink lines) train stop, which can take you to downtown Chicago, are each a few blocks away. If you have a car, the Kennedy Expressway is also nearby.

Please remember that you will be staying in a home, not a hotel. Therefore, we ask that you treat our space with the same respect you would show your own. 

***NO SMOKING INSIDE UNIT***

2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.

additional_house_rules:
SAMPLE OF THE CONTRACT YOU WILL BE ASKED TO SIGN:
                                                                                    LIABILITY:
GUEST(s) agree to indemnify, hold harmless and defend OWNER from and against any and all losses, claims, liabilities, and expenses, including reasonable attorney fees, if any, which OWNER may suffer in connection with GUEST(s) use of the premises. The owner is not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The owner is not responsible for any loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guests. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all the guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premises.

GUEST Initials __________
                                

NO PARTY POLICY:
The house is situated in residential neighborhood and the owners of these homes do not tolerate excessive noise, late gatherings, back deck or front yard gatherings. Please be respectful of your neighbors. Outdoor gatherings (limited to outdoor patios) are limited to 10:30pm. Friday and Saturday or 9:00pm. Sunday through Thursday.
If violation of our “NO PARTY POLICY” accurse, this contract is null and void and with or without written approval will result in immediate eviction from the property and forfeiture all of your damage deposit. Additional charges to the GUEST(s) provided payment source might apply if there are damages in the property or fines placed in the result of the party. 

GUEST Initials __________

                                     NO SMOKING POLICY:
Please, Do Not Smoke in the house at any time. The fees to eliminate the odors from the house can reach a $1000 and up which will be forwarded/charged to the GUEST(s). There will be an ashtray outside the front door on your left. Feel free to use that for the cigarette butts.  
NO FIREWORKS ALLOWED ANYWHERE, IN OR NEAR THE PREMISES, OR ON THE ROOF TOP, AT ANY TIME. NO MUSIC ON THE ROOF TOP AFTER 10:30PM.
Any orders of movies from Dish Network cable provider will be deducted from the security deposit. 
 
GUEST Initials __________

The property shall be vacated prior or on 11:00 AM  in the same condition as received and shall be subject to inspection by the OWNER or their agent. All doors and windows shall be locked. Keys shall be returned to the lock box or to the agent of OWNER as instructed. Because the cleaning service needs adequate time to check, clean and maintain the property between GUEST(s), there will be a $50/hour charge if this checkout time is not complied with.                                                    
                                                              USE OF SAUNA:
Push On baton on your left by the radio then set your timer and your wanted temperature (Preheat sauna for 30 min. on the 60 degrees temperature before using it). Do Not Bring, Use, Pour, 
Spill any water, liquids inside the sauna. The heating elements might give the electric shock and the wood will stain from water spills. Please use towels on the seating area while using sauna. You will find more detailed instructions about it inside the sauna on your left. Please read it to familiarize your self’s before using the sauna. Disregard the message about towels. 
Ladies, please do not use any towels for you make up removal. Stained towels will need to be replaced and the cost deducted from the damage deposit.

                                                  DECK INSTRUCTIONS:
When and if using the deck, please mind and respect the neighbors and their privacy. All the houses have the master bedrooms facing the decks, so after hours gatherings are not allowed. No fireworks allowed on the deck or near the house. Please comply with the city of Chicago quiet hour ordinance (no loud noises or music after 10:30 pm.). For additional details please refer to “No Party Policy” in the contract. You may use the grill and if more propane is needed feel free to refill it at any gas station that has propane tank exchange system.
                                                   
                                               
                                          BEFORE LEAVING THE HOUSE:
Collect all the garbage and through it in to the green containers by the garage. Put all the dishes in to the dishwasher. Leave the house the way you found it. You don’t have to take care of the sheets our cleaning crew is coming right after your stay to examine the house and record all, if any, damages. If any glasses, or other glass wear is broken feel free to replace it yourself or our crew will be glad to do that for you at your expense. No pets are allowed on the premises, unless agreed and payment collected prior to your stay. We appreciate your cooperation as well as the next guests occupying the house. 
                                                                 
                                                             BASEMENT:
Please do not bring any food or drinks downstairs. The basement is carpeted with the light color carpet and any spills leave the stains, which are easy, visible. Please take your shoes off when going downstairs. It does cost $500 to clean it professionally. To avoid the charges, please ask your guests to 
keep the food, beverages and the shoes on the first floor.

access: 3 STORY HOUSE IS AVAILABLE FOR GUESTS TO USE.
description:
Enjoy Windy City from the comfort of this 4-bedroom, 3.5-bathroom vacation rental home in the heart of Chicago. Complete with a 4-person sauna, pool table, and accommodations for up to 14, the 3,000-square-foot home offers the epitome of luxurious city living. Whether you spend your days shopping the Magnificent Mile, eating in the South Loop, China Town, Greek Town, Little Italy or in meetings downtown, you'll look forward to ending each day on the rooftop deck with your friends.

We have new cleaning crew, new management, lots of updates in furniture and beddings. It is a single family house, that can comfortably fit a large family or group of professionals, coming to Chicago for family time or business. The house has 4 people sauna, pool table, roof top deck. It is located close to train, bus and the Loop of the city. Easy free street parking is always available.

3 STORY HOUSE IS AVAILABLE FOR GUESTS TO USE.

I am 15-20 min. away if needed.

We are just a few minutes away from China Town, Little Italy, Greek Town, University Village.

Very convenient Ashland Orange line is just 5 minutes away. The bus stop is around the corner from the house. Uber easy finds the home and takes you down town just in 10 minutes.

transit: Very convenient Ashland Orange line is just 5 minutes away. The bus stop is around the corner from the house. Uber easy finds the home and takes you down town just in 10 minutes.

access:
The apartment is technically a suite located inside of a River North hotel called FieldHouse Jones.  As a guest of the hotel, guests of this listing will enjoy access to hotel amenities like 24/7 frontdesk and security, daily housekeeping, guest kitchen, lounge and washer & dryer.  The hotel also has a cafe and restaurant as well as two full-size slot car tracks which guests have access to.

Parking is available in our adjacent surface lot for $25/car/night.
description: Think cool co-working space meets modern hotel.  Enjoy a modern and cosy private room with four double sized bunk beds.  Sports themed decor adorns both the room and the common spaces, making this a playful, functional and social place to stay.
house_rules: At check-in, guests will be asked to provide a valid photo ID as well as a working credit card that will only be charged in case of damaged property.
interaction: Our frontdesk is staffed 24-hours a day to assist any of your needs at any time.  Additional, we offer guests daily housekeeping.
neighborhood_overview: Explore North River and beyond, with all of the fantastic restaurants, boisterous nightlife and the incredible art scene.  It's an area loved by both locals and tourists alike.
notes: At check-in, guests will be asked to put down a credit card for incidentals.  The card will only be charged in the case of damage to the property.
space: For the rising stars, it’s time to be catapulted into greatness! Our Signature Quad Rooms (260 square feet) feature 4-Full-size bunk beds with plush mattresses, luxurious linens and a small sitting area. These rooms feature oak flooring, a desk area and a modern private bathroom with a walk-in shower and deluxe fittings. Each guest will enjoy a separate varsity locker that offers plenty of storage space. Additional amenities include a flat screen television with cable TV channels, custom furniture, original art, in-room safe, complimentary eco-friendly bath products, and free high-speed WiFi.
summary: Think cool co-working space meets modern hotel.  Enjoy a modern and cosy private room with four double sized bunk beds.  Sports themed decor adorns both the room and the common spaces, making this a playful, functional and social place to stay.
transit:
Public Transportation: We’re about two blocks from the Chicago stop of the Brown Line.  It goes from the Loop to Albany Park.  It’s your go-to train to for getting you downtown fast.  But know that it does not run from 1am to 5am.  The Red Line is about four blocks away and basically runs up and down Lake Michigan.  Also, unlike, the Brown Line, it runs all the time.

Parking: FieldHouse Jones has an on-site lot.  Spaces are available to guests for $25/car/night.  An advance reservation for one is advised as the number of spaces is finite.
