description:
Just remodeled! Spacious 3 bdrm/ 1 bath with brand new appliances and a washer and dryer IN THE UNIT. Unit is a true 1st floor unit with high ceilings and plenty of light. Well equipped kitchen, 2 large flat screen TVs with Hulu, Netflix and HBOgo. Bluetooth enabled speaker to sync your music & Alexa spot. CENTRAL AIR CONDITIONING. FREE Street parking! Just let me know if you need a parking permit for the neighborhood ahead of time.
**NOT CORPORATE OWNED**

Newly remodeled 3 bedroom/ 1 bath ENTIRE apartment (not sharing) in the convenient neighborhood of West Town. Minutes to downtown and many sites. Plenty of FREE street parking with temporary permit (provided for you). Flat screen TV with Hulu, Netflix and HBOgo. Free internet. SECOND TV in the first bedroom. Washer and dryer in the unit as well. Well equipped kitchen with full size appliances, kuerig coffee maker, kitchen aide blender and Philips Air Fryer. Queen size high quality memory foam mattresses in each bedroom. Couch also has a trundle pull out and an air mattress can be provided by request. High quality, high thread count sheets and duvets on each bed alone with luxurious memory foam pillows. For security reasons we have a camera on the EXTERIOR of the building. With that being said please be honest with how many guests are staying over.  If this unit is booked please check out my other places!

The entire unit is yours to use.

I can be as available as you need me. I work in the night life industry and I can always help put together a fun itinerary for you if you want.

West Town is conveniently located near downtown and is close to many sites. There are cute restaurants and a corner store within walking distance. A few blocks away is beautiful Humboldt Park, one of Chicago's prized parks.

4 miles to Gold Coast/mag mile
5 miles to downtown proper
1.5  miles to Wicker Park
1 mile to Humboldt Park
5 miles to Wrigley Field
7.5 miles to McCormick Place

Uber or Lyft is the most convenient way to travel. There is also 2 bus lines 3 blocks north and south of the property. There is plenty of FREE STREET PARKING if you decide to drive as well. PLEASE let us know ahead of time if you will be needing parking permits for your car.

PARKING: Please let me know ahead of time if you will need temporary parking permits. Just place them inside the passenger side windshield. Parking is FREE on the street you just need neighborhood permit which I can provide.

EARLY CHECK-IN/LATE CHECK OUT: IF it is available, anything prior to 2pm will incur an additional $25 fee. 9am being the earliest check in allowed. Any checkOUT from 2pm-6pm (IF available) will also be allowed with an additional $25. Anything earlier or later can be discussed (IF available).

Extra guests: please be HONEST about extra guests. They will be charged at a double rate after check in. Otherwise it is $37/person/nt. We also have cameras on the exterior of the property. Thank you.
house_rules:
****bookings without reviews will have to provide an ID via the Airbnb messaging system or at check in. LOCAL, one night stays must provide IDS of all guests via messaging system PRIOR to check in. NO UNAUTHORIZED GUESTS ALLOWED****

NO SMOKING IN THE UNIT. $200 fine + cleaning fees.

Please take shoes off in unit. It's a Japanese thing and it keeps the unit cleaner. Thank you.

Please wash your dishes. There will be a $25 fee for anything more than a handful of dishes left behind.

Please BE HONEST about extra guests (first 3 guests are included in price). The extra guest fee will be doubled if you are deceptive. There are cameras on the exterior of the building.

Absolutely NO parties. Guests will be immediately evicted without refund. IF YOU ARE TRYING TO BE SLICK AND THROW A PARTY AND/OR THEN TRY TO CANCEL: I WILL KEEP WHATEVER MONEY YOU PAY PER THE CANCELLATION POLICY. 

I want to preface the following by saying 95% of our guests leave our places in amazing condition. We are very understanding about small messes that may have been overlooked as I know I am by no means perfect. That being said the following is to address the 5% who may not understand quite how airbnb works yet. 
1. We are not a hotel. 
2. We are not your personal maids. 

While there is a cleaning fee, the fee is to cover changing of linens, washing of towels and "normal" cleaning of the kitchen, bathroom and living areas. What is not covered and WILL incur an extra fee are the following: 

1. A pile of dishes left in the sink (violates house rules)
2. Excessive kitchen messes such as cooking grease all over the stove.
3. Excessive food on the floors (I dont mean a few crumbs-I mean it looked like someone was feeding pigeons).
4. Chewing gum ground into the furniture (yes, that has actually happened).
5. OBVIOUS wearing of shoes in the unit (we are a no-shoes house- see house rules) ie shoes foot prints, tracked in dirt and mud.
5. Anything else above and beyond what is considered "normal" cleaning. 
6. smoking in the unit will AUTOMATICALLY  incur a $200 fee. 

Again- this ISNT the majority of our guests and we understand things can be overlooked. Upon an "excessive cleaning" situation, I will not leave any review, I will simply send a request for an extra cleaning fee (usually around $25-50) depending on how much extra time it took to clean. Thank you for your understanding. 


Have fun!

access: The entirety of the home is yours to enjoy. For those warmer, Chicago months, there is a communal backyard patio area that is accessible and shared by all.
description:
We are thrilled you will be staying in one of our properties
The NoMad Collection was created with a fully immersive experience in mind. We wanted to bring the comfort of a private residence with a thoughtful approach to design and amenities under one roof. Within steps from Lake Michigan and conveniently located within 10 min. from downtown, our Gordon Terrace Residence is meant to be a reprieve from the hustle of the loop but close enough for all the fine dining and nightlife it has to offer.

We have taken the time to collect and curate finds from across the globe to make our properties special and unique while always welcoming. Enjoy a freshly brewed Nespresso coffee in the morning and help yourself to a fully stocked kitchen and pantry. In the evening, sift through our collection of vintage records, books and art and wind down in our Sofitel featherbed and mattresses. The property additionally offers free wifi and in-unit laundry for your convenience. 
Have a special request? Please let us know in advance and we will work with you to make your stay extra special.

The entirety of the home is yours to enjoy. For those warmer, Chicago months, there is a communal backyard patio area that is accessible and shared by all.

Buena Park is a tree-lined neighborhood bordering Lake Michigan and Lake Shore Drive. There is a walking/biking path that runs along the lake and will take you directly downtown or up north towards Evanston.  There are several grocery and convenient stores in the area, ie: Whole Foods, Go Grocer, Jewel & Osco and Walgreens, all within walking distance.  It is a peaceful reprieve from the city center but close enough to enjoy all the city has to offer.

Our property is conveniently located next to several bus lines located just at the end of both Gordon Terrace street (at Marine Drive and Clarendon Ave) that takes you directly into the loop. Both bus 135, 136 are available.  The Red Line is located a few blocks away at Sheridan and Irving Park road. If you plan on having a car,  we are just off of Lake Shore Drive, which takes you into the loop. Street parking does not require a permit on Gordon Terrace or there is valet, heated, indoor parking next door at 720 W. Gordon Terrace for a daily rate of $14.

Check-In: Our building does not allow for lockboxes. To bypass this issue, we will have your keys stored in the mailbox labeled, Frigelis. The key to the mailbox will be placed under the upper right-hand corner of the rug mat in the entrance vestibule. The keys located inside of the mailbox will be for the duration of your stay. The largest of the keys will be to access the main points, ie: downstairs doors, both front and back. The other key will be for the unit. Our unit is located on the second floor and has a green wreath. To unlock, only unlock the bottom lock and turn to the right. If you have any trouble, please make sure to pull the door towards you in order to open. 

Departure: We typically request a check out time of 11 am. If you need flexibility with this time, please let us know and we will do our best to accommodate your request. Please leave your set(s) of keys in the silver bowl on the entrance table in the foyer.

Public transportation on corner of Laverne and Madison st. That runs east (downtown Chicago) and west (Downtown Oak Park) 24/7 every ten minutes. 

You can find all these places if you go south on Cicero ave between cermak rd (22nd st) and 33rd st. About a 7-10 min drive.

additional_house_rules:
Please don't be disruptive to my neighbors and respect both my property and that of the building and neighborhood.  This means no parties, no events, no loud music, etc.  

Please take shoes off while on the shag rug in the living room.  Otherwise it is okay to wear shoes inside on the hardwood as you are coming and going, assuming they aren't caked in filth or wet from bad weather.  

Please keep most heavy food consumption in the kitchen/dining area.  A beverage or small snack is okay in the living area, take-out containers and pizza boxes all over the sofas/rug should be avoided because those areas are harder to clean.

access: You will be able to access the entire condo.
description:
860sqft (80 square meters), 2 Bedroom (2nd bedroom is an office), 2 full baths, 10ft. concrete ceiling loft with floor to ceiling windows in every room.  

You'll love my place because of the great neighborhood, dining, ease of access, and the incredibly clean and accommodating space itself.

Super clean and modern concrete and glass loft home featuring 10ft. ceilings, exposed steel ductwork, and modern decor.  

Chill living room with 40" TV, XBOX One, and Apple TV (for streaming video and audio across the network if you have an Apple device).  No cable TV.

Large deskspace in office with 34" ultrawide monitor for use with mini-Displayport cable.  Also a printer/scanner that is on the network too.

Balcony with a small table and pair of chairs.

You will be able to access the entire condo.

I will be available by phone and internet at a minimum, but may not be available in person.

Fulton Market has rapidly emerged in the last couple years, and is arguably the hottest neighborhood in the city with its proximity to the best dining Chicago has to offer.

Walkable to River North, Greektown, West Loop.  Approximately 3 blocks from the CTA Blue Line (Grand stop) or Green Line (Clinton stop).  Also easy access to buses and there's a Divvy bike share station a block away.

There is a Jewel-Osco grocery/pharmacy, Chase Bank, Starbucks, and dry cleaner all less than one block away.

description:
Apartment in the heart of Lakeview, 3rd small bedroom is connected with Masted Bedroom can be used as office or big closet as well. TV Wifi Netflix Free. Full stuck kitchen, towels, bedding.  Backyard features pool with slate deck, 1 car garage with overhead door into the backyard. Walk to everything! Whole Foods 2min walk, Southport Corridor, Wrigley, tons of restaurants, shopping, entertainment, and services. Great access to CTA Red/Brown/Purple line trains, and Buses. Washer and dryer free.

Lakeview
Share this post:
Why we love it
Lakeview’s laidback atmosphere and picture-perfect shoreline make it a favorite hang out among locals. And spots like lively Wrigleyville and the Belmont Theater District make it a major entertainment hub, too.

Insider tips
Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east, Lakeview melds several distinct areas — East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown, and Wrigleyville. Each spot has its own unique character, but they’re all pulled together by Lakeview’s casual, welcoming feel.

Hit the bustling shopping districts along Broadway in East Lakeview, along Belmont near Boystown, and the bustling Southport Corridor for local boutiques, record shops, and vintage treasure hunting. Or live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless array of bars and pubs, and the dozens of much-loved neighborhood restaurants that lie in between.

Lakeview is also known as a go-to for arts and culture — you’ll find live music venues, summer street festivals, and a thriving theatre, dance, and comedy scene. Blue Man Group is a world-famous troupe that brings music, comedy, and performance art together in one unforgettable show (if you’re sitting in the “Splash Zone”, you’ll want to put on that waterproof poncho).

On a nice day, walk east until you hit Lake Michigan. That’s where you’ll find a 1,200-acre outdoor oasis, featuring the scenic Lakefront Trail, a golf course and driving range, a boat harbor, tennis courts, and grassy fields perfect for picnicking.

Explore like a local
Grab a cup of award-winning coffee, and maybe splurge on a custom-made cruiser, at Heritage Bicycles. Enjoy craft beer, a live organist, and vintage surroundings at the Music Box Theatre. Visit the museum-like showroom at Chicago Music Exchange for a tour of one of the world’s premier vintage guitar collections.

description:
Please note that photos are of a similar Domio in Chicago.

Pair your Chicago experience with the perfect place to stay. Centrally located in the heart of Chicago, this charming space was thoughtfully designed to make you feel at home. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of architecture, food, and culture that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable experience staying at this Domio.

Everything in this home is carefully selected, made and curated according to the Domio standard. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath apartment boasts a lively living room, premium furniture, and exceptional finishes. In addition to a fully stocked kitchen with top of the line appliances, guests will be pleased to find hand picked decor and artwork throughout the home. 

Bedroom 1:
Queen Bed

Bedroom 2:
Queen Bed

Guests have exclusive access to the apartment and have access to the building's fitness center.

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

Chicago Registration Number: Pending

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.

additional_house_rules:
All bookings require a security deposit of $500 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.

Kindly note that the special reduction in Cleaning Fees is only for the Winter Season hence the regular Cleaning fees of USD 125 will be applicable for all arrivals on or after 01 March, 2019 on wards.

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in. 

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. 

Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 

Our locations do not allow pets. 

No parties of any kind are allowed in the unit.

If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 

Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 

Lost or unreturned keys will result in an additional $100 fee (per set).

If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. 

We may ask to hold in advance a damage/security deposit for last minute reservations or local stays.

If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately. 

If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance. 

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.

Shoes off, please.

access: The entire apartment is for your private use.
description:
Watch a movie in style on the 55-inch 4K TV and sound bar within this sophisticated apartment. The modern, spacious layout with metropolitan decor includes every comfort, from the Nespresso coffee maker to the complimentary designer bath products.

Designed with the traveler in mind, this 2 Bedroom Alto Suite (sleeps 6) caters to all your needs in a modern, spacious layout with metropolitan decor that gives this suite a sophisticated edge. Set against the beautiful Chicago skyline, the Noor Suite is thriving with downtown city vibes.

Alto suites offer guests a modern space with custom comforts that are a cut above the usual AirBnB experience. Each room is uniquely designed with its own stylish accents and convenient amenities to give you the perfect mixture of home and away. At the premium status level, the Alto suite provides you with a premiere experience in a premiere city.

At a Glance

* Custom furnishings 
* Alba Botanical bath and body products
* 55-inch 4K TV’s and sound bars
* Fast Internet 
* Amazon Dot
* Nespresso coffee maker w/ Nespresso pods
*In walking distance to the best bars and restaurants
*Concierge services available from 9am to 10pm (central)

The entire apartment is for your private use.

This apartment is located within walking distance of McCormick Place Convention Center. It's also only a short drive to all tourist attractions, including the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Chicago Bean.

additional_house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout

description:
Gorgeous 1BD/1BA Unit in the heart of Chicago - Rivernorth. Professionally managed and fully stocked w/ everything from salt, pepper, shampoo and body-wash to a sparkling water welcome gift!

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Our apartments are located in an upscale metropolitan neighborhood that borders the Magnificent Mile, and is just across the bridge from the Loop. River North is the go-to district for those who appreciate food, fine art and design. This exceptional living space features private balconies, over-sized closets, and hardwood flooring. Enjoy the outdoor rooftop pool and terrace with BBQ grills while looking at the scenic view of the city. Other essentials are provided such as free fast wifi, kitchen/cookware and bathroom amenities. If there are any further questions or concerns, our incredible customer support team are here to assist.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests
house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout
interaction: We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

description:
Justice Hotel at 6018North is a unique art space/hotel. For the Chicago Architectural Biennial we have transformed into a 5 room hotel that embodies ideas and actions that promote justice. We invite you to check into justice through our daily programming included in the room fee.

Justice hotel is a unique art space within an art filled mansion. The hotel offers unique programming - created by 10 ALAANA based concierges, for guests to “check in” to justice. Through conversational dinners, performances, movies, and “Sanctuary Sundays,” guests can experience justice in engaging and thought provoking ways. Employing a co-op model of ownership, we are experimenting with living and working together in ways that benefit all. We are bringing the ‘us’ to justice.  Help us create justice room by room. Breakfast and daily event included in price when you ‘check into’ justice.

Justice Hotel is a social experience. We encourage guests to check-in to the programming of the day!

Edgewater is a lakefront community seven miles from downtown on the North side of Chicago. The beach is one block away. Located in a uniquely diverse neighborhood, there is a wide range of ethnic cuisines within walking distance. We have amazing Ethiopian, Thai, Vietnamese and Indian restaurants. The # 1 coffee in Chicago - Metropolis coffee shop - is one block away, as is Indie Cafe, Income Tax restaurant, and the historical Moody's Pub.

Minutes from trains and buses. Located between the Thorndale and Granville Red Line stops. Take the 147 Express bus directly to Water Tower on Michigan Ave.

additional_house_rules:
Check In is at 3 pm. Early check in by request only.

ACCESS - Front door. We ask our guests to always remember to secure our home by locking the front door when they leave.

Please remove your shoes in our home 

We do not allow pets

Registered guests only, please 

We share many areas of our home and including the kitchen, laundry, and bath. We ask that you tidy up after yourself when using shred areas to keep the space neat for others.

We live in a residential neighborhood, so we ask that you keep noise to a reasonable level out of respect for our other guests and our neighbors.

We do not allow smoking inside the house, but you are welcome to smoke on the front or back porch.

Check out is at 10 am. Late check-out is, at times, available by request.

access: Our guests will have access to our kitchen, 2 bathrooms, our media room, living room, dining room, back entrance, limited off street parking and street parking.
description:
Our quiet, comfy, cottage home will be a peaceful retreat for you. Private Full bedroom on the second floor with shared bath. We live in an historic neighborhood with a short walk to quaint shops and Metra - Chicago is less than a 60 minute commute.

We live in an historic, quiet suburban neighborhood in a large cottage style home. You will have your own private bedroom on the second floor with a bath that is shared with other guests. 

If you wish to book other rooms for your stay, we have two other guest rooms.

For Lovely Guest Room, use this web address:
http://abnb.me/EVmg/DShWHGpeGG

For Comfy Studio , use this web address:
http://abnb.me/EVmg/8uAfwNqeGG

A short 15 minute walk into town will provide you with many fun activities and things to do - quaint shops, restaurants, pubs, theatre, PACE Bus and the Metra train which gets to downtown Chicago in about an hour. It is a 20 minute drive to O’Hare Airport and public transportation is also available via Ventra and Metra. PACE bus runs to various locations around us, including Woodfield Mall, Randhurst, and the Renaissnance convention center in Schaumburg.

Our guests will have access to our kitchen, 2 bathrooms, our media room, living room, dining room, back entrance, limited off street parking and street parking.

We are available to assist guests with any questions they may have and are very friendly, but respect our guests privacy.

We love to go for walks in our historic neighborhood, taking in the library, area parks, and the quaint downtown.

We have a PACE bus to nearby neighborhoods and shopping malls and a short walk to Metra and downtown Chicago. 

The drive to O'hare is only 20 minutes - you can take a taxi for about $40 or use Uber for about $25. Public transportation from O'hare using the Blue Line "EL" to Jefferson Park Multi Transportation terminal which is just a few steps away to the Metra train that stops in our neighborhood.

We have three guest rooms and are often fully booked. We have plenty of space and make every effort to provide a comfortable experience for our guests. 

The two upstairs guest rooms share full use of the upstairs bathroom. There is also a bathroom downstairs on the main floor that guests can use for the toilet. However, full use of the downstairs bathroom is reserved for guests in the Comfy Studio for showering and hygiene.

description:
Brand new apartment with gleaming hardwood floor! Walk to the University of Chicago Medical Center (3 blocks), Jewel grocery store (half block), Green Line train (2 blocks).

Located in Woodlawn, at the edge of Hyde Park.

"Compact" cozy room. Light-filled with jumbo windows.  Contemporary kitchen. Wood Porches. Nice backyard with BBQ.  Bathroom is shared with only one another guest bedroom. Free street parking is easy to find at the front.

Convenience to train (2 blocks), to the University of Chicago Medical Center (3 blocks)., and to grocery store (half block). 

Green Line train at 63rd/Cottage Grove will take 25 mins to Adams station in downtown (for Millennium Park).

Notes:
Kitchen has filtered drinking water. Save the environment, and save your money from buying plastic bottled water. 

Our floor coverings are hardwood and limestone. We do not have carpets. This might work well for guests who have allergies.

Free use of in-unit high-quality washer/dryer.

High-speed WIFI. (We subscribe for 1 GIG and this room usually gets approximately 350 MBPS in actual speed.)
house_rules: No shoes inside the house. Light cooking only. No oily, splashy, or strong smell cooking. Guests to cleanup dishes and cooking areas right after meals.

description:
Newly renovated, convenient one-bedroom apartment in Chicago's Roscoe Village! Less than a mile to Wrigley Field, a two minute walk to the subway, and a few blocks from all the great restaurants in both Roscoe Village and the Southport Corridor. This newly renovated 1-bedroom garden apartment features a brand new kitchen & bathroom. The perfect retreat for a weekend visit or longer stay!

The unit features one queen bed, and an air mattress can be provided upon request.

We (Lee & Laura) live in the upstairs house with our friendly 40 pound dog named Ruby!

As we are on-site, we are available to provide any assistance you may need, including recommendations on places to see and eat!

Roscoe Village is home to some amazing places and events. Local favorites include: Dinkel's (bakery), Paulina Meat Market, and Le Sud (Restaurant) to name just a few. There are a number of festivals nearby during warmer months too!

Roscoe Street features an abundance of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and shopping.

Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, and Target are a short walk away.

The Brown line train stop at Paulina St is a 2-3 minute walk. It can take you straight into downtown Chicago! If you don't want to take public transportation, it is very easy to get an Uber or Lyft from here. 

If you are driving, we are about a 10-minute drive from the Addison Street exit off 90/94. There is plenty of street parking near the house (that's what we use). 

We are also 1.5 miles from DePaul University!

description:
Beautiful 1 bedroom/1 bath apt in Chicago (Lakeview area). King bed in bedroom and pullout queen size bed in the living room. Plenty of room for 4 with street parking available. 5 min walk from the Lake MI, 5 min drive from Old Town, Boys Town, and Wrigley Field. 10 min drive from River North, Gold Coast, and North Ave Beach. Over 100 restaurants, shops and bars within a 15 min walk. 10 min walk to the nearest El train stop. In one of Chicago's safest, cleanest, and friendliest neighborhoods.

Plenty of room for 4 people, but will allow 6 if discussed with the owners prior to stay. Full kitchen available. Full access to washer and dryer. Free street parking is available around the neighborhood.

Will be available by phone during your stay to answer any questions. 2 sets of keys will be provided to guests once they are approved for stay.

Wrigley Field, North Avenue Beach, Lincoln Park Zoo. Right off of Lakeshore Drive for easy access to Soldier Field and Downtown Chicago.

There is plenty of street parking available and also pay for parking if there are no spots available. There are Divvy bike stations within walking distance for a bike ride down the Lakefront Trail. There is also a Brown Line stop a 10 minute walk from the apartment.

If guests are interested in a length of stay that is not approved on the calendar- please send a message- we may be able to accommodate the dates.

description:
My place is located in a friendly, tourist attractive neighborhood very close to Chinatown, McCormick Place Convention Center, and Downtown Chicago. You will love my location for its clean comfortable environment that makes you feel like a true local. 

McCormick Place is 1 short mile from this property, making it a perfect location for visitors attending events at the convention center. And it is a short walk to the CTA Red and Orange Line Stations that go directly into the heart of downtown!

My place has a great cozy feeling to it while remaining modern and hip.

I recommend Ming Hin, Joyee, Chi Cafe, Connies Pizza, and Burger Point as dining options.

CTA Red Line is located on Archer and Cermak, it will take you through the downtown area all the way north through Wriggleyville and all the way to Rogers Park.

space: My place has a great cozy feeling to it while remaining modern and hip.
summary:
My place is located in a friendly, tourist attractive neighborhood very close to Chinatown, McCormick Place Convention Center, and Downtown Chicago. You will love my location for its clean comfortable environment that makes you feel like a true local. 

McCormick Place is 1 short mile from this property, making it a perfect location for visitors attending events at the convention center. And it is a short walk to the CTA Red and Orange Line Stations that go directly into the heart of downtown!
transit: CTA Red Line is located on Archer and Cermak, it will take you through the downtown area all the way north through Wriggleyville and all the way to Rogers Park.

highlights: [{'type': 'LISTING_SELF_CHECKIN', 'message': 'Check yourself in with the smartlock.', 'headline': 'Self check-in'}]
description:
Two beds in a centrally located private room with FREE PARKING for travelers who wish to sleep separately. You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 3 p.m. and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed.

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF ! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.

The neighborhood is QUIET and SAFE, even at night!

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 5 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)
The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door.

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like. You can park 2 cars!

> 2 different beds with sheets, blankets and towels. Memory foam GREEN TEA mattresses.

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO

> 3 MIN walk to University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC)

> 15 MIN walk to Rush University

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation.

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

"UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

access: Guests will be sent instructions on how to access the home (lockbox and keypad)
description:
2 bedroom, 1.5 bath home available in Bucktown. All-brick vintage building on a quiet, tree lined street. We have a beautiful outdoor space for warm evenings and a cozy fireplace for colder evenings. Walkable to the 606 elevated path and Damen restaurants, shops and the Damen or Western Blue line.

Two rooms, one room has a queen size bed, one room has a twin day bed and a crib (used as the nursery) and there is a comfy pullout twin couch downstairs if another bed is needed . A full bathroom upstairs and a powder room downstairs. We have wireless internet, 2 living rooms both with working TVs and cable and a cute outdoor space. Washer/dryer, there is street parking around our home.  Reach out if you have questions on any of the amenities we offer.

*Please note this is our personal home that we Airbnb so our personal belongings are in the home.

Guests will be sent instructions on how to access the home (lockbox and keypad)

We don't plan on being here when guests are around but if we are, we are very friendly.

Our street is a quiet and tree lined street but we are two blocks from Damen St which has many great restaurants. A couple more blocks walk is the six corners, North, Damen and Milwaukee.

The Blue line is a short walk from our house, the 50 bus and 73 are also very close. We are more than happy to explain how to use the public transit to get where you want to go.

This is our personal home that we AirBnB

access: Guests have access to all common areas of the townhouse.
description:
Private bedroom with added amenities to help make your stay comfortable.  Bedroom in a single family townhouse in the heart of Hyde Park and minutes away from the University of Chicago.  

Bedroom equipped with a mini-refrigerator, keurig, microwave, TV (Netflix, Hulu, etc.), and separate semi-private bathroom.  

Parking also included

This is a beautiful and large bedroom located within a historical town house in the heart of Hyde Park. Town house has a front and back entrance along with sufficient street parking. Bedroom is located on 2nd floor walk-up and is equipped with all essentials.  Kitchen is equipped with all essentials and then some. Home is located two block walking distance from President Obama's home, 15 minute walking distance from the well-known Harper Court and Harper Movie Theatre, 15 minute walking distance to Promontory point and 57th street Beach, and a ten minute walk main University of Chicago campus.

Guests have access to all common areas of the townhouse.

I will meet you upon arrival to show you the home and local community. I am currently a student and also take care of my two young daughters every other day and will also be reachable by phone for any questions or concerns.

It is in the heart of University of Chicago with such an incredible level of culture, diversity, and architecture. Home is located two block walking distance from President Obama's home, 15 minute walking distance from the well-known Harper Court and Harper Movie Theatre, 15 minute walking distance to Promontory point and 57th street Beach, and a ten minute walk main University of Chicago campus. Everything you need is at hand, grocery stores, vintage bookstores, ice cream shops, movie theatre, and a local farmer’s market.

Metra CTA Bus Divvy bike rental

access: You will have access to my whole place.  The kitchen, bathroom, coin washer and dryer in the back are all open for you to use.  There's also a nice stone patio area to sit out back.  Your sleeping area is the main living room where there are a couple of futons that open to a full sized bed. I also have an air mattress if you prefer.  However, to reach the bathroom, you will have to pass through my bedroom.
description:
My place is close to Boystown, Wrigley Field, Belmont Harbor, Belmont and Addison CTA stops and near multiple CTA bus stops.  The Briar Street Theater (Blue Man Group) is a 10 minute walk. You’ll love my place because of the location!  My place is good for couples and solo adventurers.

My place is a spacious, one bedroom, garden unit in the heart of Boystown (Lakeview) neighborhood of Chicago.

You will have access to my whole place.  The kitchen, bathroom, coin washer and dryer in the back are all open for you to use.  There's also a nice stone patio area to sit out back.  Your sleeping area is the main living room where there are a couple of futons that open to a full sized bed. I also have an air mattress if you prefer.  However, to reach the bathroom, you will have to pass through my bedroom.

I work Monday through Friday 9-6 so am usually around in the evening.  I'm a very social and fun person, so I'm always up to chat, hang, get drinks or just let you do your own thing.  Please, no outside guests are to be brought into the unit.  You are free to call or text me anytime if you need assistance.

BOYSTOWN (NOUN)
boasting the best shopping, famous nightlife,
biggest events, and wonderful community.

The first officially recognized gay village in the United States, Boystown in Chicago, Illinois is the commonly accepted nickname for the eclectic East Lakeview neighborhood that is home to Chicago's visible and active LGBT community. Boystown Chicago is situated just southeast of Wrigleyville in Lakeview.

The two main (north-south) avenues of Halsted and Broadway dominate the heart of this commercial district. Both avenues cater to a lively nightlife with more than 30 different bars, nightclubs and restaurants. Not a night owl? Don't worry! Boystown is home to some of Chicago's premier shopping including apparel, art galleries, and more. Stay as long as you like, there are more than enough salons and places to pamper yourself day or night. Immerse yourself in Boystown Chicago!

10 Minute walk to the Belmont Red, Brown and Purple lines.  Minutes from numerous CTA bus stops.
interaction: I work Monday through Friday 9-6 so am usually around in the evening.  I'm a very social and fun person, so I'm always up to chat, hang, get drinks or just let you do your own thing.  Please, no outside guests are to be brought into the unit.  You are free to call or text me anytime if you need assistance.

description:
Charming two bedroom plus living/dining room, private entrance garden apartment, close to public transportation (red line to downtown), the lake, theater, restaurants, and parks. Edgewater is known for tree-lined streets and is a quiet, safe, diverse, and friendly neighborhood.  We provide breakfast foods (coffee, tea, fresh fruit, cereal, bread and homemade jam).  There is a microwave, small fridge, and double burner electric appliance for light cooking.

There are two nice size bedrooms and a living/dining/ kitchenette room that comfortably sits 4 people.  There are two entrances to the bathroom: one through a bedroom and one through the hallway.  Plenty of light with new furnishings.

We live upstairs and are available to answer questions, print out tickets from our printer, refer to great Chicago restaurants, etc. We also will respect guests' privacy.

Very diverse and friendly. Close to everything. Tree lined streets and lots of green space.  We are close to great shopping in Andersonville, Lake Michigan is just a few blocks east; the train to downtown which takes about 25 minutes is just a few blocks from us.  There are about 100 restaurants within 1 mile of our apartment featuring every type of ethnic food and other specialties.

Yes, we are close to red line, Broadway bus, #47 Express to Michigan Ave.

access: Guests enter the building through the rear door of the building and walk through the basement common area (laundry room, kitchenette, storage room, workshop) before reaching the suite, which is at the front of the building.
description:
Small furnished suite in daylight basement with access to kitchenette, private bath, good natural light and ventilation, and a nice view of the street and garden.

Rooms are in finished basement of an owner-occupied two-flat. 30-day minimum, with strong preference given to guests who will stay for an entire semester or summer season.

These two cozy, bright furnished rooms are ideal for someone coming to Chicago for a month or more. Think internships, semesters, work stays . . . This is a quiet Victorian building in a pleasant residential neighborhood.

The small bedroom holds a full bed; the bedroom and sitting room together are about 220 square feet.

The kitchenette and bathroom are adjacent to a shared laundry room. However, no one else uses the kitchenette or bathroom.

Guests enter the building through the rear door of the building and walk through the basement common area (laundry room, kitchenette, storage room, workshop) before reaching the suite, which is at the front of the building.

I can be as available as you need me to be, but you'll have plenty of privacy. I'm more than happy to give you tips about how to get around, places to go, or the local roots music scene.

I'm down in the basement every day or so for one reason or other; the other tenants are down there mainly just to do laundry.

Neighborhood features excellent grocery stores and middle Eastern restaurants. More nightlife—coffee shops, restaurants, bars, movie theaters, and the Old Town School of Folk Music—are just a mile away in Lincoln Square.

We are close to public transportation (10-minute walk from the Francisco and Kedzie stops on the Brown Line; 3-minute walk from the Montrose bus).

I give preference to people who will stay for an entire season, i.e. a summer or semester.
house_rules: Seeking guests who are quiet and respectful.
interaction:
I can be as available as you need me to be, but you'll have plenty of privacy. I'm more than happy to give you tips about how to get around, places to go, or the local roots music scene.

I'm down in the basement every day or so for one reason or other; the other tenants are down there mainly just to do laundry.
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood features excellent grocery stores and middle Eastern restaurants. More nightlife—coffee shops, restaurants, bars, movie theaters, and the Old Town School of Folk Music—are just a mile away in Lincoln Square.
notes: I give preference to people who will stay for an entire season, i.e. a summer or semester.
space:
These two cozy, bright furnished rooms are ideal for someone coming to Chicago for a month or more. Think internships, semesters, work stays . . . This is a quiet Victorian building in a pleasant residential neighborhood.

The small bedroom holds a full bed; the bedroom and sitting room together are about 220 square feet.

The kitchenette and bathroom are adjacent to a shared laundry room. However, no one else uses the kitchenette or bathroom.
summary:
Small furnished suite in daylight basement with access to kitchenette, private bath, good natural light and ventilation, and a nice view of the street and garden.

Rooms are in finished basement of an owner-occupied two-flat. 30-day minimum, with strong preference given to guests who will stay for an entire semester or summer season.

- Quiet hours between 10pm and 8am, 7 days a week.  Please use headphones and quiet voices during these hours.

- Please remove shoes at door and do not wear in the apartment.
- No more than 1 overnight guest for over 7 days in any 30 day period
- 2 or more simultaneous overnight guests not allowed unless previously authorized

Any issues with autocharges after the 2nd month that aren't resolved within 24 hours are subject to a $100 penalty if not resolved within 24 hours of Airbnb sending the notification.

access: Full, private access to everything pictured inside apartment.  Laundry room shared with other building residents.
description:
Per the City of Chicago laws & ordinances, 31 night minimum on all stays. Newly remodeled two-bedroom apartment with ultra modern finishes, smart technology & security, in a hip, central neighborhood minutes from downtown Chicago and steps from all that trendy Bridgeport has to offer. Professionally managed by a seasoned team specializing in monthly furnished rentals.

-Onsite indoor garage potentially available - please confirm availability prior to booking if you require this (as there are more apartments than there are garage spaces).  If unavailable, there is free unmetered street parking that is generally very available directly outside the building
-Zinus Queen 8" plush memory foam mattresses and pillows
-New Samsung washer/dryers available for your use just a few steps from your apartment (located inside building).  Free for your use (not coin operated)
-Lighting-quick wifi (1000Mbps)
-Smart 50" LED television with built in Roku streaming for use with Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, HBO, etc.
-Smart keypad locks for security and convenience
-Units within building are only rented for a minimum of one month, and the tenants are typically busy healthcare professionals and business travelers. Issues common to having Airbnb vacationers as neighbors are generally non-existent due to the longer-term nature of tenants’ stays.
-Detailed instructional video tours on how to operate everything you need in the home are sent in advance of your stay and helpful written guides are displayed throughout the home.

Full, private access to everything pictured inside apartment.  Laundry room shared with other building residents.

Prior to booking, an in-person viewing may be possibly arranged only if there is not a current resident living in the property - please check the listing's calendar on your proposed viewing date to confirm that it might be possible. Should you book the property, please note that you will be the beneficiary of this policy as well, and we will never inconvenience you with showing requests during your stay. Viewing all the pictures, descriptions, and reviews of this listing as well as others in the area is a great way to familiarize yourself with the property, location, and living experience.

Permission to enter – unless you request otherwise, please note that if any repair/fix is discovered and needs to be addressed, we will provide 24 hours notice that someone on our staff will be entering the unit address it.  We will do our best to provide an accurate timeframe in these circumstances.

Bridgeport is the quintessential Chicago neighborhood.  Widely considered among the safest of Chicago neighborhoods with a close proximity to downtown, it features popular dining options, culture, Chicago sports and other points of interest just steps away.  Downtown is minutes away via public transportation as well as numerous business districts, hospital systems, & universities.

The nearest intersection to the apartment building is 28th Place and Canal Street (exact address not disclosed prior to a confirmed booking so as to be sensitive to our current residents' safety and security.)  We are happy to help with questions regarding proximity to your work/school in communications prior to booking however please note that we too use likely the same online map search that you would use as well :) in order to make sure we are describing it accurately.

4 minute walk to the CTA 44 bus
4 minute walk to Divvy (city-wide bike sharing)
8 minute walk to the CTA 24 bus
9 minute walk to the CTA 8 bus
15 minute walk to the CTA Train (Halsted station, Orange Line)
18 minute walk to the CTA Train (35th station, Red Line)
12 minute walk to grocery store Cermak Fresh Market
13 minute walk to CVS pharmacy
21 minute walk to Mercy Hospital & Medical Center
12 minute drive/uber to Rush/Cook County/UIC Hospital systems
14 minute drive/uber to Mt. Sinai Hospital
14 minute drive/uber to Cinespace Chicago Film Studios
10 minute drive/uber to downtown center (Jackson/Dearborn)

Please note that the entire reservation amount is NOT due at the time of booking :) One month's rent is charged, and then the rest is charged by Airbnb in monthly installments. https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/245/how-do-i-pay-for-my-long-term-reservation

We are a monthly stay company only and thus we do not apply a monthly discount on our Airbnb listings: our "nightly" rate already reflects the pricing for 30 days or more.  Any further discounts to our listed rate need to be approved by owners, and factors that they value include but aren't limited to:
-potential stays longer than 3 months
-potential guests with 2 or more positive Airbnb reviews
-detailed inquiries that demonstrate that you have reviewed the entire listing's descriptions and that help us feel that you would be a good fit for the space.  Happy to answer clarifying questions of course, but we invest a considerable amount of time to make sure our listings are thorough, accurate, and current, and appreciate those potential guests who take the time to review the listing in its entirety.
-potential guests who demonstrate that they have read through the entire listing and mention the color yellow anywhere within their first message to us 
-reservations that begin soon after the previous guest's departure (view listing calendar)
-reservations that end close to the subsequent guest's arrival (view listing calendar)


We aim to be competitive and fair with our pricing.  To that end, if you request a discount, providing links to other Airbnb listings you are considering for a "price match" type of process can also potentially increase the owners' willingness to offer a discount.

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.

access:
Guests will have private access to the entire apartment.  There is also a shared backyard for guests on the property.

Stress Free 24 Hour Check-In!  Extra free street parking is available in the neighborhood as well as some metered parking.
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

This spacious 3 Bedroom Flat on West Melrose St. is 1600 square foot with all the modern amenities for the discerning traveler. A shared backyard, 1 garage space and plenty of space filled with art, will be perfect for your group to relax and feel at home! O'Hare to the Belmont Blue Line train stop--15 minutes away! Eco-friendly Cleaning!

This Large 3BR Apartment is brand new and well furnished to make you feel at home.   It has everything you need for a short stay or extended stay, including fresh linens, towel service, and a hair dryer.  The kitchen is well stocked with free fresh coffee and tea, and all necessary kitchen appliances and utensils.

The 50" Roku Smart TV is internet connected so you can use it to go online, watch movies on your Amazon, Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Pandora account! Basic Cable also included. 

Nest Learning Thermostat keeps the living space comfortable.

Green Living, we Proudly use green, non toxic cleaning products and make every effort make your stay flawless and as comfortable as possible.

Guests will have private access to the entire apartment.  There is also a shared backyard for guests on the property.

Stress Free 24 Hour Check-In!  Extra free street parking is available in the neighborhood as well as some metered parking.

The history of Irving Park and Logan Square is probably the first thing that stands out to me. Noted by many for its historic homes, I love strolling the streets of Irving Park/Logan Square to admire its architecture. As a lover of bungalow-style houses and all things historic, I have a soft spot for Irving Park.  The area also has loads of transportation, which makes it easy to come here for the day or commute in/out if you make this your home.

I love the peaceful tree lined streets, and also the easy access to every restaurant and bar in Chicago.  Great access to Wrigley Field and all that Chicago has to offer!

Check out the Kilbourn Park Organic Greenhouse! The first-ever public fruit tree orchard in a major metropolitan city was planted in Kilbourn Park at the Greenhouse in fall 2008!  It is a wonderful resource for the community and visitors alike.

Free street parking is available along with some metered parking.

Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round BIKE sharing system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!  This is a great way to explore the neighborhoods of Chicago and you can drop bikes off at any other Stations!

Home to Belmont Blue Line Station (0.9 Miles)
Belmont Blue Line to/from O'hare Airport (16 min)
The #77 Bus takes you straight across Belmont to the Station and back home!

#56 Bus 2 blocks away on Milwaukee Ave will bring you into Logan Square, Wicker Park, Bucktown, and River West in Minutes!

Easy to Grab Uber/Lyft...about 15 Minutes to the Loop!
15 Minutes to O'hare Airport Via Car!

Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round bike share system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!

Please note - that while the home is beautifully situated for indoor use - we have strict guidelines regarding noise, in accordance with City of Chicago and neighborhood laws. We respect our neighbors greatly, and simply ask that you do the same. We do penalize aggressively for violations of this - including reporting by neighbors or ticketing by police.
house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.

description:
Welcome to Brookfield's Finest Home & Patio

You'll enjoy this spacious home filled with tons of light in the heart of Brookfield! The property includes a large living room, Bonus Room off the Spacious Kitchen, and an Awesome Breakfast Bar that overlooks the Dining Area. Your room is located is on the second floor adjacent to your bathroom.  Relax at the deck with tons of greenery around including a fire pit and bbq grill. The home is less a mile away from the infamous Brookfield Zoo.

description:
Imagine arriving in a newly renovated 3BR/@BA within a cozy brownstone on a quiet city block within walking distance of the lake.  There is easy access to the energy of Downtown, Lakeshore Drive, and all major highways.

This condo is conveniently located in Bronzeville, a neighbor of Hyde Park and South Loop.  The main living area is modern, yet cozy.  There is a washer/dryer onsite.  The living room as well as 3 bedrooms offer a flat screen TV that includes basic cable, ESPN, HBO etc.  There is a master bedroom with adjacent bath which houses a spa tub.  There is WIFI throughout.  The charming dining room that seats 6.  Towels, dishes, cookware, and toiletries are provided.  Baby bed and pack n play are available upon request.  There is also a desk set-up and free WIFI to promote a productive workspace when needed.

Your host will responsive to messages from the Airbnb app, text, and phone calls during your stay.

Bronzeville, in between Hyde Park and South Loop
Close proximity to University of Illinois, McCormick, White Sox Park

Bus stop on the corner, within walking distance of the train, and close access to all major highways (90/94, 55, Lake Shore Drive)

access: All shared areas (all areas other than personal bedrooms, including kitchen, living room, and dining room) are accessible to you.
description:
A cozy bedroom in a friendly shared 3-bedroom apartment in a recently renovated building. The bedroom has two windows facing north, and is fully furnished with a double bed, a nightstand, a small dresser, and a walk-in closet.

The apartment is conveniently located in the heart of the lovely Hyde Park neighborhood, between the University of Chicago campus, Lake Michigan (Promontory Point), and the commercial district on the 53rd Street.

The bedroom is fully furnished with a double bed, a nightstand, a small dresser, a walk-in closet, a nightstand and a bed lamp. Suitable for one person or a couple.

The shared area of the apartment includes a living room with sofas, TV, and a fine collection of books (poetry, fiction, and philosophy), a beautiful dining room with a wooden table for 6 people, a kitchen with a refrigerator, a dish washer, and an oven, two bathrooms with shower and bathtub. Two sun rooms at the front and back of the apartment are perfect spot for sitting down and having a sip of coffee, chilling out or doing work. There is also a newly purchased treadmill which you are welcome to use for daily exercise.

All shared areas (all areas other than personal bedrooms, including kitchen, living room, and dining room) are accessible to you.

You can always reach me by mobile phone, email, and airbnb message function.

In general, you will be sharing the apartment with three roommates (each has their own bedroom). We are friendly, sociable graduate students at the University of Chicago in various disciplines. We love hosting guests and are willing to help if there is anything you need.

The apartment is conveniently located in a recently renovated building in the heart of the Hyde Park neighborhood, close to the University of Chicago campus, Lake Michigan (Promontory Point), the commercial district on the 53rd Street (with shops and restaurants), and the famous Museum of Science and Industry. All of these within walking distance!

There are two very nice bakery cafes (Fabiana's, Sip and Savor) on the same street one block away. Ten-minute walk to Target, Whole Foods Market and Hyde Park Shopping Center (with Walgreens, Office Depot, Elston Ace Hardware, and US Post Office). One block away from lake front, where you can swim in the summer and enjoy the view of the lake and the city!

Convenient access to public transportation. The bus stop 54th St/S Hyde Park Blvd is right in front of the house. From there Bus 6 takes you to downtown Chicago (the Loop) in less than 30 minutes. Bus 171 takes you to the University of Chicago main campus in less than 10 minutes. The 51st/53rd Street Metra Station is located two blocks away.

description:
Private room in a central location with FREE PARKING & an EARLY check-in! (11 am!) You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 11 a.m. and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. 

The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)

The room will be solely yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door. 

> EARLY check-in: 11 AM!

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> Full-sized mirror in your room 

> Air mattress for 3rd person

> 5 MIN to DOWNTOWN 

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance 

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO 

> 3 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago)

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation. I will also be providing a binder full of local recommendations to eat and go out, you will find the binder on the bed in your room.

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

"UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
space:
Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)

The room will be solely yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door. 

> EARLY check-in: 11 AM!

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> Full-sized mirror in your room 

> Air mattress for 3rd person

> 5 MIN to DOWNTOWN 

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance 

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO 

> 3 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago)

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation. I will also be providing a binder full of local recommendations to eat and go out, you will find the binder on the bed in your room.
summary:
Private room in a central location with FREE PARKING & an EARLY check-in! (11 am!) You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 11 a.m. and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. 

The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)

description:
• Luxury private room located In the heart of Uptown/Wrigleyville
• 24 hour Serviced apartment with hostess living in the first floor to help you with any request
• Complimentary quality Coffee & Tea
• Superfast Wifi (250-350 MB/sec)
• 4K HDTV + Roku + YouTube TV
• Fully equipped, stocked, amazing kitchen
• 4 private parking spaces
• High Chair + Play pen for babies 
• Bunch of table games
• Brand new Laundry machine and Drier
• Before leaving this page, check out the photos, please! ;) Peace!

This is a private room in a 3BR newly remodeled and renovated apartment(August 2019). Restaurants, shops, bars, Aragon ball room and Wrigley Field, Montrose beach are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 15-minute train ride away via the adjacent Argyle Red Line station. EXCELLENT for medical students or patients who visit WEISS MEMORIAL HOSPITAL.

Additional amenities and information:

• Hostess living in the building. Ready to help and support with any requests 24/7
• 3 Queen Size Beds, 1 Queen Size Sofa Bed 
• Laundry in the building 
• A/C + Heat (Nest Smart Thermostate)
• Custom furnishing 
• Keurig coffee machine and Keurig pods
• Around 40 Twinning tea types for your taste
• VonShef Egg cooker
• High Chair for kids
• Play Pen for kids
• Iron + Steamer for clothes
• Shampoo + Conditioner + Soap
• Toothbrush(individual) + Toothpaste(individual)
• Small one time use cotton hand towels(individual)
• Black&Decker Hand vacuum cleaner
• Professional First Aid Kit
• Black&Decker 4-slice toaster
• Wine Glasses + Wine opener
• Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher Blender
• Arctic Chill ice cube trays
• Revlon Volumizing hair dryer
• Cuisinart set of Stainless steel knives + steak knives
• Mixology Bartender Kit
• Epicure battery operated Salt and Pepper Grinder set + Himalayan pink salt
• Ceramic knife set
• Sewing kit
• Phillips 4K HDTV + YoutubeTV + Roku TV + Pluto TV(free movies)

Dear guest,

If You wish to stay in our place but the date You're looking for is gone in calendar, You could still check for the other rooms. Don't forget that we have 6 rooms available for our dear guests within our premises. Please check out the links below for the other rooms:

1. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/38132264
2. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/38080914
3. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/38101368
4. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/37977237
5. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/37949860
6. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/38082581

Apartment is equipped with:
• Smart security systems (by RING)
• Smart Doorbell system (by RING)
• Smart outside Camera (by RING)
• Smart CO2 and heat/smoke detection systems (by NEST)
• Smart thermostate (by NEST)
• Smart flood and freeze systems

access: Guest have full access to the common areas. We are located on the second floor, so you will need to climb a flight of stairs. Laundry is easy access through the back located in the basement.
description:
The apartment has 4 bedrooms that Zoe and Christina live in with their 2 dogs, and 1 other room that is also listed on AirBnB! We have a 7 lb Shih Tzu, she is older and very quiet, you will forget she is in the home! We also have a Doberman, friendly, will keep to herself - when you arrive we will introduce you to the dogs. We are very social young professionals that enjoy many different areas around the city and we are happy to provide any information or tips to make your trip to Chicago epic!

The home is flooded with natural light and beautiful views of the tree lined street and park. We have a fully equipped kitchen and coin laundry in the basement.

Guest have full access to the common areas. We are located on the second floor, so you will need to climb a flight of stairs. Laundry is easy access through the back located in the basement.

Once arrive, we will introduce you to the dogs so everyone feels comfortable!

Hip area - very close to all the Logan Square life, but blocks away that it is very peaceful and quiet on our block.

Easy street parking, walking distance to the Healy Metra Station, blocks from the Fullerton and Armitage bus stops that will bring you right to the El.

description:
Large studio apartment in Boystown with a large separate kitchen and dining area. The apartment is on the third floor (no elevator). There is a balcony outside of the kitchen with flowers and chairs to relax and sip on your morning coffee.

I am always available by cell and my sister also lives down the street, so you'll always have one of us nearby and easy to reach!

The apartment is situated between Boystown and Lakeview East neighborhoods. There are plenty of restaurants and a lot of nightlife nearby, but the neighborhood still tends to stay quiet because there are a lot of families. It is near the lake and Lake Shore Drive, as well as, a 5 minute walk to the Belmont Red/Brown/Purple lines.

The apartment is a 5 minute walk to the Belmont Red/Purple/Brown train lines and easily accessible to the Halsted bus and the Clark Street bus.

access: Living room and kitchen
description:
Private bedroom in a 2-bed 1-bath apartment. Fully furnished with closet space and a study table. The living room, kitchen and bath is part of the shared area.

Ideal for anyone visiting Evanston since we're just blocks from downtown, the NU campus and the lakefront. Only 30 minute train ride into downtown Chicago.

Living room and kitchen

As needed - happy to answer questions and spend time

The apartment is located conveniently near the Noyes Purple line train stop. The neighbourhood is safe and quiet, with a grocery store, multiple restaurants, and coffee shops nearby. Evanston downtown is a 15-minute walk, and the campus is ~10 minutes away. The Northwestern shuttle has a stop in front of the apartment (and is free for students).

Apartment is next to a train station, and has plenty of free street parking if driving.

description:
Shared space as I live in the unit.
5 minutes from Midway, 3 blocks from the Orange line (20min to downtown), right off the I-55 highway (5miles from downtown). Close to to everything in a safe quiet neighborhood surrounded by schools. Security system with surveillance for extra precaution with street parking (permits provided).

Espresso machine 
Toaster
Microwave
Fridge 
Washer/dryer
*no stove or oven; hasn’t been installed yet.

In-unit laundry.

I live in the apartment and will always be available .

Super quiet neighborhood close to public transportation and highway.

2 blocks from the Pulaski Orange line stop;30min to downtown. Also, 1 mile from the I-55 Pulaski exit; 15 min from downtown.

I have 3 French Bulldogs so if you have pet allergies this won’t be a match. They will be contained to the back area of the house during guest stays.

LGTBQ friendly.
