access:
A lock box containing the keys will be located outside the door. Guests will be given the code to the lock box upon booking confirmation.
Please leave keys on the coffee table and lock the front and back doors when you check out.

Guests have access to everything on the second floor. Guests will not be given keys to the individual bedrooms. The bedroom doors lock from the inside so that you can still have privacy while you are inside the bedroom. Please leave bedroom doors unlocked when leaving the room.
description:
Welcome to my home! This clean and spacious condo is conveniently located between Midway Airport, Chinatown, and Downtown Chicago. Public transportation, grocery store, and local restaurants are all within a 5 minutes walking radius. 3 bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms are perfect for a family or small group stay. The simple and modern design has all the essentials to ensure your stay is comfortable and hospitable.

I have things to do and places to go!
It is a 6 minute walk from the route 62 bus and close to the Orange Line Train Station, which takes you to Midway Airport, Chinatown, and Downtown Chicago. The route 9 bus across the street takes you directly to University Village and Little Italy. 

I'm hungry...
It is a 3 minute walk between the local restaurants and grocery stores like Mariano’s, White Castle, The Patio, Popeye’s, Burger King, Subway, and more.

The home essentials.
Wifi internet connection, Chromecast Smart TV, and laundry are included to make you feel at home.

The amenities.
Towels (extra towels can be found in the closet of each bedroom), Shampoo/Conditioner, Hair Dryer, Body Wash, Hand Soap, Linens, Silverware, Cookware, Dishes, Coffee Maker, Plates, Cups, Dish/Laundry Detergents

Time to sleep.
The 3 large bedrooms each have its own closet for your storage and lock for your privacy. Each room comfortably sleeps two people and the two futons in the living area sleeps one person each. Extra comforters and pillows are located in the living area closet.

Nature call.
One full bathroom and a half bathroom allow for convenient and efficient usage for group stays. 

Laundry.
Washer and dryer is available. Laundry detergent and fabric softeners are provided.

Call me Master Chef!
For those who likes to cook, the kitchen comes with cookware, knife set, silverware, dishes, bowls, and cups for your use. 

The Neighbors.
The neighbors are very friendly. Downstairs is a hair studio. Guests are welcome to get their haircuts there! Upstairs is a family with a small child that may get a little rowdy at times. If the loud noises from the neighbor becomes an issue, guests are free to kindly confront them.

Where do I park?
Free street parking is available.

Bathtub/Coffee
Some guests have given me some constructive feedback about the bathtub and lack of coffee maker. Those words were heeded. The bathtub has been re-glazed and now looks like new! Coffee maker and coffee are now included as part of the amenities!

A lock box containing the keys will be located outside the door. Guests will be given the code to the lock box upon booking confirmation.
Please leave keys on the coffee table and lock the front and back doors when you check out.

Guests have access to everything on the second floor. Guests will not be given keys to the individual bedrooms. The bedroom doors lock from the inside so that you can still have privacy while you are inside the bedroom. Please leave bedroom doors unlocked when leaving the room.

The best way to communicate with me is via email or text message. If you need anything, do not hesitate to contact me. I will be 10 minutes away from the property.

Feel like making a home-cooked meal? Mariano's across the street has a large variety of ingredients for you to show off your culinary expertise. 

Tired from a long day of adventure and looking for a bite? How about a juicy whopper from Burger King? Or delicious sliders from White Castle?

It is a 5 minute walk from the route 62 bus and the Orange Line Train Station, which takes you to straight to Midway Airport, Chicago Chinatown, or Downtown Chicago. 

The route 9 bus across the street takes you directly to University Village and Little Italy.

The condo is located on the second floor, this requires a 1 floor walk up. There is no elevator service in the building.

A shoe rack is outside for you to place your shoes. Slippers are available for indoor use.

Extra towels are available in the closet of each room.

Extra pillows and comforters are available in the closet of the living area.

Since this is in such a convenient location, the typical Chicago hustle and bustle noise is to be expected.

Upstairs is a family with a small child that may get a little rowdy at times. If the loud noises from the neighbor becomes an issue, guests are free to kindly confront them.

access:
KEYS
We will provide 2 sets of keys for your stay. In case keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee.

HEAT/AC
The unit has central heat/AC for your convenience with a thermostat within the unit.

WASHER/DRYER
A washer and dryer are located in a shared laundry room. Detergent is also available for your use. Note the laundry room is reserved 10am-4pm daily for our cleaning team.

CRIB
Pack-and-play crib may be rented for $5/day with 2+ day advance arrangements. Please mention this during booking, and it will be inside unit waiting for you. Note that you must supply your own sheets and blankets for the crib.
description:
Steps away from everything the trendy Wicker Park neighborhood has to offer, but tucked away on a cozy side street, this apartment can't be beat! A perfect space for a long stay or weekend getaway!
Cozy and comfy 2 bedroom/ 1 bath unit in hip Wicker Park. Feel right at home with a full kitchen, bathroom and trendy decor. Steps from top bars, restaurants, grocery store and public transit! Perfect for a group looking to experience Chicago and have some fun!
*Expand for more info*

The unit features 10 ft ceilings and has all the comforts of home. We provide all the towels, linens, toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion, etc.) and coffee/tea to get you going in the morning! 

OPEN LIVING ROOM / KITCHEN: Pull-out couch, television, coffee table, and reading chair, plus Full Kitchen with island and stools. Paper towels, sponge, dish soap, dishwasher detergent, trash bags, coffee, sugar, creamer, cookware/dining ware, and kitchen towels are provided.

BEDROOM 1: Queen Bed; linens, pillows, comforter/blanket are provided. Closet with hangers.

BEDROOM 2: Bunk Beds; linens, pillows, comforter/blanket are provided. Closet with hangers.

BATHROOM: Full shower with shower stall, vanity & toilet. Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, trash bags, bath towels, hair dryer, and bath mat are provided..

KEYS
We will provide 2 sets of keys for your stay. In case keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee.

HEAT/AC
The unit has central heat/AC for your convenience with a thermostat within the unit.

WASHER/DRYER
A washer and dryer are located in a shared laundry room. Detergent is also available for your use. Note the laundry room is reserved 10am-4pm daily for our cleaning team.

CRIB
Pack-and-play crib may be rented for $5/day with 2+ day advance arrangements. Please mention this during booking, and it will be inside unit waiting for you. Note that you must supply your own sheets and blankets for the crib.

Our team is available to answer your questions and make your stay pleasant. We are just a phone call away.

You will be a few blocks from the hottest restaurants, bars and clubs in Chicago. Wicker Park is, simply put, one of the best neighborhoods in the city. Think Brooklyn, Austen, or Madison. Michelin star restaurants like Schwa co-exist with some of the world's best dive bars. The nightlife in the summertime is can't miss.

You'll be about 2 blocks from the Division Blue line, which will take you to "The Loop" in about 5 minutes. You are a short walk to a wide range of restaurants and bars.

CHECK-IN
Check-in is self-entry at 4pm or later. Luggage storage may be available from 10:30am-3pm if arranged in advance.

PARKING
Please note that the free parking is street parking, so you will need to look for a spot once you arrive. The free street parking is first-come, first-served and distance from unit cannot be guaranteed. For parking closest to the property, there are daily sticker parking passes available for a nominal convenience fee.

COURTESY
Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors and keep quiet hours from 10pm-8am. Therefore, if your group is looking for more of a party environment, please allow us to recommend another unit that would be better suited for that noise level.

CHECK-OUT 
Check-out is by 10am. If you check out late or do not follow the check-out steps, you may be charged an additional cleaning fee. Luggage storage may be available from 10am-4pm if arranged in advance.

- Dirty linens can be left as is with used beds left unmade. 
- Please bag all trash and dispose in black bins behind building. Recycling goes into blue bins and should be loose or in an open brown bag.
- Please place dirty kitchen items in dishwasher and begin cycle. 
- Return all keys as you found them upon entry

additional_house_rules:
Before you book, please be aware of the following:

We strive to maintain the absolute highest standard of service on Airbnb.  However, we are not a 5-star hotel and are therefore unable to provide everything that you would expect from a hotel.  If you have specific things that you are very picky about, please discuss with us before booking.

Due to changing regulations on Airbnb in Chicago, we must ask that you maintain discretion with building staff.  Please do not approach them with any requests.  Definitely do not approach them to collect keys or “check-in.”

Please review the notes in the Location section of the listing before making your booking.

Once you arrive, we will ask you to follow our house rules.  

Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously.  Failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.This building is 100% non-smoking.  No smoking or vaping of anything inside the unit or on building premises.  Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
2.This a quiet and upscale residential building.  Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. Our neighbors are very sensitive and they will report loud noise.
3.Absolutely no guests not in the reservation are allowed in the apartment or the building.
4.Pets are not allowed at the property.
5.Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed-upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out fee.
6.Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $200 per key fee.

access: As an ENVITAE Guest, you will have full access to building amenities. This includes the common rooms, billiard tables, swimming pool and gym.
description:
Experience the lifestyle you deserve in a premier River North building. This exquisitely designed ENVITAE 2b/2b apartment features luxury finishes and is located in the lively neighborhood of River North; a district offering the cities highest concentration of art galleries, nightlife and restaurants. Relax in the artisan building lounges, take a dip in the pool, or relax on the deck while taking in the stunning views of the surrounding city. This is what luxury living is all about.

Located in River Norths best building, this home is close to just about everything. You are just minutes away from some of Chicago's best locations, including Michican Avenue, shopping centres at Northbridge and Water Tower Chicago. 

With access to the line stops, CTA buses, and taxi services, it is a quick commute to anywhere in the city. The building itself offers a sophisticated, boutique style with with a touch of sophistication. 

You will never want to leave this home, after experiencing the amenities that are out of this world. Enjoy views and drinks on the building sky deck, play some billiards, have a work out or take a dip in the pool.

As an ENVITAE Guest, you will have full access to building amenities. This includes the common rooms, billiard tables, swimming pool and gym.

While staying with ENVITAE, you'll have 24/7 access to our concierge desk for an inquiries or requests you may have. Your personal Guest Relations Manager will meet you upon arrival, get you settled in and answer any building or neighbourhood questions for you.

Everything you need is right outside your doorstep! Downtown Chicago is a city with an appetite—for food, of course, but also for design, history, and culture. Come here to marvel at the cutting-edge architecture or take in the gorgeous views of Lake Michigan; to spend a day cheering with baseball fans and a night laughing at a comedy show; to shop; to visit renowned institutions like the Field Museum, The Art Institute and the Adler Planetarium, and to experience the legendary blues scene. To do all this, you'll need nourishment: taste deep-dish pizza, piled-high hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches, and more.

You are minutes away from bus and train stops.  

We find our guests prefer to use Uber, which is a very convenient and cheap way to get around the city. If you are arriving at the airport, inquire into our ENVITAE Life Plus and Elite plans for premium transport upon arrival and departure.

For parking, we recommend the apps SpotHero or ParkWhiz to find and book parking.

This unit is currently being renovated, photos are from a similar unit in the same building.

Please be advised that all guests will be asked to sign a rental usage agreement that governs the terms of your stay.  For the protection of all parties, the booking party will also be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in. This information is collected for verification purposes only and is not stored or otherwise used for any other purpose

By completing the reservation you agree to the following:
- I agree to be bound by our rental terms and conditions.
- I acknowledge that I will be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in.
- I acknowledge that I may be required to undergo a background check if mandated by the property management company or the building, as stated in accordance by my rental agreement and condition of the booking.

access: Entire basement is available for Airbnb guests.
description:
Brand new basement remodel.  2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom and a family room. Unit has a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave and induction cooktop.  Private, spacious and beautifully decorated in a contemporary style; cable TV. Work area with desk and WiFi. Location close to great restaurants in Evanston and transportation by CTA, Metra and PACE with abundant shopping.

Basement apartment in a quiet, 2-flat building. Each unit has private entrance from the lobby.

Entire basement is available for Airbnb guests.

I am available to all guests as needed.

Quiet, tree lined neighborhood. Close to public transportation, shopping and restaurants.

Close to CTA and Metra. Plenty of street parking for your personal car. Approx. 7 minutes to the lakefront and Northwestern University. 5 mins from downtown Evanston. 20 minutes on Metra to downtown Chicago. Check with host regarding transportation to/from train stations and to O’Hare airport.

Free street parking with lots of availability.

access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment. There is a door that leads to the back, but that will be kept locked, providing guests a key for emergencies.
description:
This is an old house that we are repairing. Our daughter lives in the top apartment, and there is a neighbor living in the first floor. We've lived in this neighborhood for over 20 years and would love to share our space with people traveling to Chicago. It is a basic set-up, with what you need for a comfortable and simple stay. The apartment is located in Little Village, one of Chicago's largest Mexican neighborhoods, and surrounded by local restaurants and cafes.

This is a three bedroom, garden-floor, apartment. There is one main room, with two individual rooms with single beds, and two convertible couches. The apartment is facing Marshall Boulevard, a historic boulevard in Chicago that provides grass and trees to relax under in the summer. It is located half a block away from the bus and two blocks from the pink line trainstation.

Guests will have access to the entire apartment. There is a door that leads to the back, but that will be kept locked, providing guests a key for emergencies.

I live two houses away, but like to give guests their independence.

The apartment is located in Little Village, one of Chicago's largest Mexican neighborhoods, and surrounded by local restaurants and cafes. There are local street vendors with tamales and fresh fruit just half a block during winter, as well as local restaurants. We are also two blocks away from Douglas Park, a large park where summer activities and concerts are held. The apartment is facing Marshall Boulevard, a historic boulevard in Chicago that provides grass and trees to relax under in the summer. It is located half a block away from the bus and two blocks from the pink line trainstation.

Parking is available on the street and side streets. Chicago Transit Authority has a bus that stops half a block away, and the train is two blocks away.

Check-in is preferred any time after 3 pm to give us some time to get the apartment ready. Although somewhat flexible, we ask for an extra $20 for early check-in, particularly if it is before noon.

There is an extra $30 per guest per night after 4 guests. Please make sure you mark the appropriate number of people who will be staying at the appartment. 
Please note that some city noises can be heard from the apartment, including music from neighbors during summer time and a neighbor's dog once in a while. The apartment is one and a half blocks up the stairs.

access: Coded door lock for easy access!  Self Check-in.  The east side gang way leads to the entrance to the rear unit, and the shared backyard space with small wood porch. Guests are welcome to use the porch and back yard.
description:
Perfect location to explore the "City of Neighborhoods", from wonderful West Town.  Central location to everything Chicago has to offer. Ukrainian Village, Wicker Park, Bucktown, Logan Square all very close.  

People from all backgrounds are welcome in our home. We are normal people, and we enjoy hosting other normal people.

Everything new at this property - This unit is a 1st floor duplex down unit in the rear of the building.  It has 1 bedroom and 1 bathroom on the main level, and 2 bedrooms and a bathroom on the lower level.  Dark stained bamboo floors on the main level, Carpet in all of the bedrooms.  10' ceilings on the main level and 8' ceilings on the lower level.  White shaker cabinetry with soft closing doors and drawers, granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, etc.

Coded door lock for easy access!  Self Check-in.  The east side gang way leads to the entrance to the rear unit, and the shared backyard space with small wood porch. Guests are welcome to use the porch and back yard.

I am available to help with details of your stay in Chicago, or stay out of your way! Just let me know which you prefer!

Located in the Ukrainian Village pocket of West Town, one of Chicago’s great neighborhoods! Walking distance to everything you need from grocery stores, restaurants, bars and shops. Friendly and safe roads make it a great place to live and visit!

Shared rides and taxi are the fastest at times. There is also a CTA bus stop on both nearby main roads, both of the busses go directly to the Western Blue line train stop and the Chicago Blue line train stop or “L” which go to downtown and directly to the O’Hare airport. Parking outside the place is free on weekends, and not during school hours. Since there is an elementary school across the street, permit parking is enforced during school hours. There is 24/7 parking on Western Ave just East of the property and on other nearby streets.

House rules are mainly related to noise levels at late hours / disturbing other tenants in the building, or neighbors to the East and West.  If you intend to use the unit for loud partying all day and night, then this is not the space for you.

Parking outside the place is free on weekends, and not during school hours. Since there is an elementary school across the street, permit parking is enforced during school hours. There is 24/7 parking on Western Ave just East of the property and on other nearby streets.

access:
Fairly unusual to Chicago neighborhood homes, the Drake is located on a Chicago city lot and a half so there is front yard, a large backyard, and a very large side yard. There is also a deck in the rear of the building that comes off the second floor attached to Peter and Kristin’s place; you are more than welcome to hang out on the deck which has tables and chairs. 

Although Peter and Kristin live above the apartment, The Drake is completely separate and private; you'll be able to enjoy as much privacy as you wish. Total transparency note: the laundry washer and dryer and located in a shared utility room accessed from the back door of the unit; however, these machines are exclusively for your use as the upstairs unit has its own.
description:
Located in Chicago's Irving Park neighborhood, our brand new, full-time AirBnB space, The Drake, is in a perfect spot to home-base your work or play visit. Close to Wrigley Field, the ''EL" Blue Line, I-90, and the airport, you'll find our spot to be cozy, comfortable, and convenient!

The Drake is in the historic Irving Park neighborhood with an off-street parking spot, if needed, and additional parking passes for the street if you have multiple cars. The Drake is smaller but super cozy as you can see from the pix, around 900 square feet, with two bedrooms, an eat-in kitchen, a bathroom, and a separate laundry area. The sofa converts into a full-size bed that can sleep a fifth person. The Drake has terrific light and somehow manages to always be the perfect temperature no matter what the season. We’ve added a large, flat screen TV with an Amazon Fire Stick loaded with apps to use and, of course, WiFI is provided. The Drake is a garden unit that is three steps below street level.

Fairly unusual to Chicago neighborhood homes, the Drake is located on a Chicago city lot and a half so there is front yard, a large backyard, and a very large side yard. There is also a deck in the rear of the building that comes off the second floor attached to Peter and Kristin’s place; you are more than welcome to hang out on the deck which has tables and chairs. 

Although Peter and Kristin live above the apartment, The Drake is completely separate and private; you'll be able to enjoy as much privacy as you wish. Total transparency note: the laundry washer and dryer and located in a shared utility room accessed from the back door of the unit; however, these machines are exclusively for your use as the upstairs unit has its own.

Becky and David, the owners, live in rural Illinois about 70 miles from The Drake. But The Drake is still our home: we first lived here together, were married while living here, and adopted many four-legged children here. Our friend, Peter, lives in the unit upstairs and has since we moved to our current home in 2012; Peter’s roommate, Kristin, has also lived at The Drake for several years. Peter is our onsite AirBnB Manager, and is a Chicago fireman and paramedic, so you can feel confident that The Drake is well managed and safe.

The Irving Park neighborhood is truly one of the best to get a real feel for life in Chicago: older but gentrifying, tree-lined streets lined with homes with families of all ages, and minutes from other amazing neighborhoods.

One of the best things about The Drake, is its location in a great neighborhood with easy access to the rest of the city. The Drake is located 1/2 block north of Irving Park Road; hop on the Irving Park 80 bus and head three miles east to Wrigley field. Or, if you are interested in using the EL / subway like a true Chicagoan, the Blue Line, which travels between O'Hare airport and the Loop downtown, is less than a 3/4 mile walk. If you are driving, you're likely using the main artery in and out of downtown, or to O'Hare, which is I-90 known as the Kennedy Expressway in Chicago; the Kennedy on ramp is a four minute drive from The Drake.

If you have any physical limitations, you may want to consider the following:

*The apartment is a garden unit three steps down from street level.

*The bathtub shower is a step over a short wall into the tub.

If this is your first time with Airbnb, welcome, but please familiarize yourself with the concept - this is our home and NOT a hotel. 

We truly welcome all walks of life and believe on being inclusive; everyone is welcome to our home irrespective of orientation, background, origin, or other factors that make us unique. The only exception is that if you are looking for a party palace, this is not the location for you; we don't want any drugs or other illegal activities going on in our home - this is a family area.

Other notes to be transparent:
Our base rate is for two people, each additional person beyond the first two people is an additional $10 per person per night. While the unit sleeps five, that will get a little snug.

We have plans to rebuild the front entrance to The Drake; the construction around the front door, and the front door itself, leave a little to be desired so next spring/summer we plan to: rebuild the walls and overhang around the entrance, replace the front entrance, and add a keyless entry lock to The Drake.

We are continuing to add amenities to The Drake; if anything is missing that we stated, if anything is not working, if anything was not appropriately stocked or cleaned to your satisfaction on arrival, PLEASE let us know urgently so that we can rectify this. We have AirBnB SuperHost status and the only way for us to maintain that is to ensure we provide the experience that we promise.

description:
This is a great opportunity to start with this place where you are middle of Boytown and Wrigley Field with tons of bars hopping. Only one block away from Cubs Stadium. Also, Red Line Addison Train Station which 5 minutes to walk to go everywhere you want to see!

Sweet private bedroom with queen bed and TV. Also, there is sparkle lights around the big mirror front of your sight.

You can use anywhere to make yourself like home! As long you respect our furnitures and others cleaned before your check out, please. Also, turn off the heat and furnace whenever you are ready to check out and text me confirmed once you are completed check out. You can return the key back to masterlock. 

Please remove the shoes and leave on the mat or bring with you either way to keep the floor clean due to our culture do not allowed to walk shoes or boots inside of the apt. Thank you for being understanding!

Knowledgable host with 24-hour communication.

Neighborhood walking distance from wrigley and convenient public transportation.

There is red line train station, Addison Station which is 5 minutes to walk from my place!
Red line - Addison stop
Busses - Halsted St  (8) or Clark St (22) or Addison St (152)
Grocery Store Jewel-Osco is on Broadway Street which is 5 minutes to walk
Water Tower Place and Navy Pier are 10-15 minute car rides away, save for traffic
Also, there is more public transportation you can use by bus, train, cabs, uber, or lyft.

access: In addition to your private bedroom and shared bathroom, you'll have shared access to our common space and kitchen and dining amenities. You're also welcome to our spacious yard, gardens, and deck. There is free, unrestricted parking is available right out front!
description:
Welcome to Portage Park, one of the most hip yet quiet neighborhoods in the city. We offer a peaceful retreat from downtown and encourage our guests to dive into the hustle and bustle of the City, explore all Chicago has to offer before returning home to our northwest-side neighborhood and kicking back in our cozy digs in the evening!

This is a private bedroom with a queen-sized bed and bathroom on the second floor of our home.

Enjoy a relaxing stay by sipping tea in our sunroom, reading under a handmade quilt, or eating breakfast on our picnic table. We have a multitude of books and board games that you're welcome to use. We compost and recycle; if our eco-conscious practices are different than what you're used to, please just ask!

We invite you to enjoy the amenities of our urban farmhouse by sipping tea in our sunroom or taking breakfast to the picnic table to watch our chickens peck about, harvest chocolate mint tea or fresh oregano, enjoy fresh eggs and garden produce when it's available (we are in between flocks so no chickens currently). We practice composting, recycling, and limit our energy use and welcome our guests to participate. We know that our eco-conscious practices may be different than what you're used to so please just ask!

We have one cat, Jubilee, who shares our living space. She will be present in all common spaces. Please don't leave your personal belongings laying about because she will sleep on it!

In addition to your private bedroom and shared bathroom, you'll have shared access to our common space and kitchen and dining amenities. You're also welcome to our spacious yard, gardens, and deck. There is free, unrestricted parking is available right out front!

Please let us know what you need! We are often out and about, but always available by text or phone. We're happy to answer any questions, provide directions or recommendations, and offer as much or as little info as you need to make your visit as comfortable and memorable as possible.

Portage Park is a neighborhood on the northwest side of the City. We are just a few walkable blocks from two gorgeous parks, two public swimming pools, coffee shops, gyms, delicious restaurants, and bars in Portage Park, Jeff Park, and Six Corners nearby.

We also live four blocks from an international fruit market and have a liquor store at the end of our block! 

Check our guidebook for dining and entertainment recommendations including Filament Theatre, National Veterans Art Museum, Ed Paschke Museum, and The Gift Theatre. Catch the Chicago festival bug in the summer with 6 Corners BBQ Fest, Jeff Park Arts & Music Festival and Chicago Fringe Fest, and Taste of Polonia. Find out why we love to call Chicago home!

If you are traveling by public transportation, it will take you approximately one hour to get downtown, longer depending on where you're going. If you are looking for close proximity to downtown, this is not the listing for you.

Our house is easily accessible by public transit and Uber. There is free parking out front. Belmont and Irving Park buses run 24 hours.

-- Wrigley Field = 40 min. on Addison bus
-- Downtown = 15 min. to Addison blueline, 45 min. train ride
-- Downtown = 20 min. drive (non-rush hour)
-- O'Hare = 15 min. to Addison blueline, 25 min. train ride
-- O'Hare = 20 min. drive (non-rush hour)
-- Rosemont = 15 min. to Addison blueline, 20 min. train ride
-- Rosemont = 15 min. drive (non-rush hour)
-- Logan Sq./Wicker Park = 15 min. to Addison blueline, 15-20 min. train

We often have a long-term housemate living in the studio apartment in the basement. They may be around the common space as well.

Also, we have one cats that lives in our home, Jubilee.

description:
Our place is located in a suburban neighborhood in Niles, IL. 

***Please note: we have tenants on the 2nd floor with children and they CAN be loud at times but they know that “quiet hours” are after 10 pm.***

Highlights include:
-Close to major highways (94, 294, etc)
-Downtown Chicago: 15 miles away
-O’hare airport, Rosemont, All-State Arena: 5-6 miles away
-Advocate Lutheran Hospital: 2 miles away
-Grocery stores, restaurants, and bars nearby
-Public Transportation within walking distance

You may only use Room B and the shared restroom. All other areas are NOT shared.

We are usually in and out due to our crazy schedules. The best way to reach us is by messaging us. We will respond ASAP!

This neighborhood has a cozy, suburban  feel with neighbors walking their dogs, mowing their lawns, and hanging out at the local park nearby. 

There is a Walgreens, 7-11, Jewel, Rosati’s, McDonald’s, and a local fast food joint called Booby’s within walking distance. 

If you drive 10-15 minutes North or South, you pretty much have access to anything you want!

Uber and lyft are readily available. The bus stop is also close by

Please note again that there are kids upstairs who run around and play like kids do. The tenants are told to keep their kids quiet after 10 pm. 

Also, we currently have renovations and projects going on throughout the unit. Most of it is done so we won’t be working too much while you are here. We will do our best not to disturb you.

Lastly, we have a puppy in the unit. We keep in our room but she may bark when she hears you walking around. We will do our best to keep her quiet.

For all of the inconveniences listed above, we do our best to keep our daily rates relatively low.

access:
Chicago Club Inn & Suites features an indoor pool, as well as a fitness room. Business-related amenities include a 24-hour business center, 2 meeting rooms, and complimentary wireless and wired high-speed Internet access.

A complimentary breakfast buffet is served each morning and includes assorted hot items. The hotel also offers a 24-hour coffee bar in the lobby.

An outdoor courtyard can access the hotel's wireless network and includes gazebos, patio areas, and gas grills. The hotel has two meeting rooms that can accommodate small groups and on-site parking is complimentary.

Chicago Club Inn & Suites is a smoke-free property.

An outdoor courtyard can access the hotel's wireless network and includes gazebos, patio areas, and gas grills. The hotel has two meeting rooms that can accommodate small groups and on-site parking is complimentary.

Chicago Club Inn & Suites is a smoke-free property.

Our 24 Hours Front Desk Service will help anytime you need help.
Free breakfast
Free parking
Pets allowed
Free WiFi
Indoor Heated Swimming pool

Downtown Chicago - approximately 18 Miles,
Oakbrook Mall & Yorktown Malls,
Brookfield Zoo,
Morton Arboretum,
Aurora Outlet Mall

access:
The two front doors have an automatic lock keypad. You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing. 

Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside.
description:
We are located by the I-290 and a 10 minute walk to the CTA. Enjoy your stay in our home. You will have a private room with a full sized bed. Closet with hangers and extra storage space in the dresser. 42” Tv with Roku in your room. 

Shared office desk available.

55” TV with Roku in the shared Living Room. 

Plenty of free street parking available in front of the home and in the back.

-Located on the first floor. 
-Full Sized Bed comfortably sleeps two. 
-Carpeting throughout the house. 
-Bathroom stocked with shampoo/conditioner, and body wash.
-Kitchen has stove, microwave, fridge, and cooking utensils. All accessible to you at any time.
-Smoking allowed on front porch

The two front doors have an automatic lock keypad. You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing. 

Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside.

We are not always on the property, but we are a phone call or text away. When I am around I like to socialize with the guests.

15 minutes from Logan square
18 minute drive to Sears Tower
10 min walk to the Garfield Park Conservatory 
Close to public transportation (82 bus, and green line) 
10 minuets from United Center
24 minuets to Navy Pier
23 minutes to Oak Street Beach
25 minuets to The free Lincoln Park Zoo
19 minuets from Millennium Park/Grant park
24 minuets to Shed Aquarium, the field museum and the Adler planetarium.

The train is a 10 minuet walk. Uber and lyft is always 5 minuets away. Bus Stop is also just steps from house

Smoking is allowed on the front porch outside.

access:
You will have access to the following:

> Free WiFi, central air conditioning & heating.

> Private room includes: queen-sized bed, 2 night stands, fresh bed linens, fresh towels, closet with hangers, iron & ironing board, hair dryer, lock on the door with a key.

> Kitchen includes: refrigerator, table, microwave, stove, fridge, dishes, and pots.

> Living room includes: Sofas, chairs, coffee tables.

> Bathroom includes: bathtub/shower, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, toilet paper

> Closet to store your baggage before your check-in and after your check-out
description:
Private room in a central location with FREE PARKING,  & an EARLY check-in! (11 am!) You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 11 a.m. and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. 

The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)

The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock your door. 

> EARLY CHECK-IN! 11 AM!

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> 5 MIN to DOWNTOWN

> 3 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago)

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance 

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO 

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation. I am also providing a folder full of recommendations for restaurants, nightlife and places to visit from the local, it will be on your bed upon arrival :)

You will have access to the following:

> Free WiFi, central air conditioning & heating.

> Private room includes: queen-sized bed, 2 night stands, fresh bed linens, fresh towels, closet with hangers, iron & ironing board, hair dryer, lock on the door with a key.

> Kitchen includes: refrigerator, table, microwave, stove, fridge, dishes, and pots.

> Living room includes: Sofas, chairs, coffee tables.

> Bathroom includes: bathtub/shower, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, toilet paper

> Closet to store your baggage before your check-in and after your check-out

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

"UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

I am also providing a folder full of recommendations for restaurants, nightlife and places to visit from the local, it will be on your bed upon arrival :)

You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation. I am also providing a folder full of recommendations for restaurants, nightlife and places to visit from the local, it will be on your bed upon arrival :)
summary:
Private room in a central location with FREE PARKING,  & an EARLY check-in! (11 am!) You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 11 a.m. and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. 

The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)
transit:
"UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
